title: Project Engineer - Civil
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.
 
About Us 
 
 Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.
 
 Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.
 
 Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 Your Opportunity 
 
 We are looking for a Civil Project Engineer to join our Engineering Team on a 2:1 FIFO Roster. Reporting to the Civil / Structural Discipline Manager and Project Manager, you will be required to work on a newly awarded NPI EPC project near Newman, WA. 
 
Your Key Responsibilities 
 * Ensure compliance of design products with the Design Procedure.
 * Produce and ensure design products comply with applicable legislation, standards, client, third party and project requirements.
 * Ensure technical compliance of design products.
 * Ensure design products are delivered in accordance with the project budget and schedule.
 * Ensure designs are fit for purpose and consider all aspects including, cost, constructability, operability and maintainability.

 What You ‘Can Do’
 * Bachelor of Civil Engineering (recognised by IEAust).
 * 3+ years’ experience in the mining/mineral processing or oil and gas sector.
 * Thorough knowledge and practical application of relevant industry codes of practice.
 * Advanced level of expertise in technical detail of Civil Engineering.
 * Experience working with Concrete will be highly regarded.
 * Ability to rapidly understand and assimilate project and client specific requirements.
 * Knowledge and practical application of design theories, principles and practices.
 * Experience with development of technical engineering documents, drawings, schedules, and models.
 
What we ‘Can Do’ for you:
 * Competitive Compensation
 * Flexible Working Arrangements
 * Career Opportunities
 * Paid Parental Leave
 * Health and Wellbeing Support
 * Benefits & Discounts
 * Employee Referral Rewards
 
 If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.
 
 Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.
 
APPLY NOW
 
 If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.
 
 Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
 
 Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Electrical Project Engineer
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity 

We are looking for a Electrical and Instrumentation Project Engineer to join our dynamic project team. Reporting to the Project Manager, you will have the opportunity to work on a newly awarded NPI EPC project located near Newman, WA. 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and coordinate electrical construction scopes from design review through to installation and handover
  • Oversee subcontractors and direct-hire crews to ensure works are delivered safely, on schedule, and to specification.
  • Review electrical drawings, specifications and technical queries.
  • Support development and execution of construction plans, work packs, and methodologies.
  • Monitor progress against schedule and budget, identifying and resolving risks and constraints.
  • Coordinate with engineering, procurement, and construction teams to ensure materials, equipment, and resources are available.
  • Ensure all electrical works comply with project standards, Australian Standards, and Rio Tinto requirements.
  • Maintain accurate project documentation, reporting, and records.
  • Actively contribute to HSE leadership, toolbox talks, and continuous improvement initiatives.
     

What You ‘Can Do’

•       Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (recognised by IEAust).

•      3+ years’ experience in the mining/mineral processing or oil and gas sector.

•      Thorough knowledge and practical application of relevant industry codes of practice.

•      Ability to rapidly understand and assimilate project and client specific requirements.

•     Advanced knowledge and practical application of design theories, principles and practices.

•     Advanced experience with development of technical engineering documents, drawings, schedules, and models.

•     Innovative and flexible approach to problem solving, an ability to analyse and resolve complex issues.

•    Site experience during construction preferred.

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

•    Competitive Compensation

•    Flexible Working Arrangements

•    Career Opportunities

•    Paid Parental Leave

•    Health and Wellbeing Support

•    Benefits & Discounts

•    Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Ingénieur(e) procédés principal(e) - Canada / États-Unis
description_html:
Ingénieur(e) en procédés principal(e)

Lieu: Canada (Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver, États-Unis)

Type: Permanent à temps plein

 

Groupe Primero Amériques offre une opportunité pour un(e) ingénieur(e) principal(e) en procédés expérimenté(e), souhaitant jouer un rôle clé dans la croissance de nos activités en Amérique du Nord et contribuer de façon significative à l’orientation technique et stratégique de nos projets.


Fondée en Australie en 2011, Primero s’est bâti une solide réputation dans la livraison de solutions EPC/EPCM de haute qualité dans le secteur du traitement des minerais. Au cours de la dernière décennie, nous avons étendu avec succès nos activités au Canada et aux États-Unis, avec des bureaux établis à Montréal, Houston et Toronto, ainsi qu’un portefeuille de projets en pleine croissance dans les domaines de l’or, du cuivre, du lithium et des minéraux critiques.

Ce poste s’adresse à un(e) ingénieur(e) chevronné(e) qui recherche plus qu’un simple rôle de projet — une personne motivée par le leadership technique, le développement des affaires et un impact durable à long terme.


Le poste d’ingénieur(e) en procédés principal(e) sera responsable du développement continu et de la mise en œuvre des fonctions d’ingénierie des procédés au sein de Primero Amériques. Cela comprend la planification, l’organisation, l’ingénierie et la supervision de toutes les études de faisabilité, des essais en laboratoire ainsi que le contrôle des activités de procédés afin d’assurer la conformité avec les objectifs de l’entreprise en matière de santé, sécurité, environnement, qualité, échéanciers et production. De plus, le rôle pourra inclure un soutien aux initiatives de développement des affaires afin de maintenir la charge de travail et l’efficacité du bureau d’études. Cette position relève du gestionnaire de procédés.

 

Responsabilités principales:

  • Agir en tant qu’expert technique pour les questions de métallurgie et de procédés, en offrant des conseils et un soutien d’expert aux équipes et aux consultants. Mettre l’accent sur l’amélioration continue des installations existantes, incluant la santé et sécurité, la sûreté, les procédures de travail, la formation technique et le coaching, l’optimisation économique à long terme des sites miniers et de traitement, ainsi que la conformité aux codes et règlements applicables.
  • Développer des modules de formation informatisés pour les opérations, la santé et sécurité, les procédures d’échantillonnage et de laboratoire, entre autres.
  • Responsable de la réalisation d’études de cadrage, de préfaisabilité et de faisabilité bancaire. Encadrement et constitution d’équipes sur des projets, au sein de firmes d’ingénierie et sur des sites miniers. Fournir des recommandations pour l’acquisition de propriétés, les stratégies à court et long terme, les scissions et les fusions-acquisitions.
  • Gestion du développement de projets et de l’ingénierie pour l’industrie minière et minérale sur divers projets.
  • Expérience approfondie en traitement des minerais incluant la récupération de l’or, de l’argent, du lithium, du cobalt, la flottation des sulfures et oxydes, la concentration gravimétrique, la séparation par milieu dense, le concassage, le broyage, le criblage, l’épaississage, la filtration, etc.
  • Développement des affaires, marketing et ventes, selon les besoins.


Profil recherché: 

  • Diplôme universitaire ou équivalent en production et en ingénierie.
  • Au moins quinze (15) années d’expérience en ingénierie, exploitation et/ou mise en service.
  • Expérience dans l’industrie minière, avec un fort accent sur les opérations et la conception liées à l’or et au cuivre.
  • Solides compétences analytiques et de résolution de problèmes, avec une grande attention aux détails.
  • Excellentes aptitudes en communication orale et écrite
  • Capacité à travailler efficacement avec les collègues, les clients et des équipes multidisciplinaires.
  • Bonne compréhension des principes HSE, des codes applicables et des normes d’ingénierie.
  • Habileté à lire et interpréter des spécifications, des schémas et des dessins d’ingénierie.
  • Flexible, ingénieux(se), capable de performer sous pression et dans un contexte de changements continus.
  • Engagé(e) à livrer un travail de qualité dans les délais prévus et à diriger par l’exemple.
  • Expérience en développement des affaires et en gestion des relations clients.
  • Esprit d’équipe, axé(e) sur la sécurité, orienté(e) service, guidé(e) par l’intégrité et la croissance de l’entreprise.

 

Détails du poste:

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidats doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada et/ou aux États-Unis
  • Salaire compétitif adapté à vos compétences et à votre expérience
  • Assurance complète payée par Primero dès le premier jour
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur de 5 %
  • Jusqu’à 10 jours de congé de maladie payés par an
  • Horaire flexible, possibilité de travail hybride
  • Atmosphère de travail conviviale et décontractée

 

 Envoyez votre candidature à: RH@primero.ca

title: Ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e) - Canada / États-Unis
description_html:
Ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e)

Lieu: Canada (Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver, États-Unis)

Type: Permanent à temps plein

 

Primero offre une opportunité pour un(e) ingénieur(e) principal(e) en mécanique expérimenté(e), souhaitant jouer un rôle clé dans la croissance de nos activités en Amérique du Nord et contribuer de façon significative à l’orientation technique et stratégique de nos projets.


En tant qu’ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e), vous agirez comme expert technique en ingénierie mécanique au sein de Primero. Vous serez responsable de diriger et de réviser des calculs mécaniques complexes, des devis techniques, des fiches techniques, des listes d’équipement (MEL) et des évaluations de fournisseurs. Ce rôle offre une expertise technique avancée et un soutien dans la conception mécanique, l’analyse, la sélection d’équipement, l’exploitation et l’exécution de projets. L’ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e) veillera à la qualité et à la cohérence de tous les livrables mécaniques pour les études et projets d’ingénierie détaillée en cours, tout en encadrant et soutenant l’équipe. Selon les projets, il pourra également agir à titre de chef de discipline mécanique ou de gestionnaire de secteur sur certains projets miniers. Ce poste relève du chef de discipline – ingénierie mécanique.

 

Responsabilités principales:

  • Agir comme qu’experttechnique en ingénierie mécanique sur les projets de Primero Amériques, en veillant à ce que les conceptions respectent les normes de qualité, de sécurité et de performance.
  • Rester impliqué dans la conception : effectuer et vérifier des calculs détaillés, préparer et réviser les fiches techniques, devis, rapports et dessins.
  • Diriger les livrables mécaniques complexes liés aux équipements et systèmes majeurs (concasseurs, broyeurs, convoyeurs, CVC, tuyauterie, etc.).
  • Gérer les lots d’équipements : élaborer les spécifications, évaluer les soumissions, répondre aux questions techniques et coordonner avec les fournisseurs et les clients.
  • Fournir un encadrement technique aux ingénieurs et aux concepteurs, tout en participant activement à la production des livrables.
  • Soutenir la conception et la modélisation 3D, encadrer les concepteurs et participer aux revues de modèles au besoin.
  • Normaliser et améliorer les méthodes, outils et gabarits d’ingénierie pour instaurer les meilleures pratiques au sein de la discipline mécanique.
  • Offrir un soutien technique à l’approvisionnement : s’assurer que les équipements respectent les exigences techniques et contractuelles, et conseiller sur les mesures d’atténuation des risques.
  • Participer activement aux phases de construction, d’installation et de mise en service, en résolvant les problèmes techniques sur le terrain et en apportant un soutien pratique au besoin.
  • Représenter Primero comme expert technique lors des réunions avec les clients, des rencontres techniques et des discussions de l’industrie, afin de renforcer la réputation de l’entreprise comme partenaire technique de confiance


Profil recherché: 

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique (maîtrise considérée comme un atout).
  • Licence d’ingénieur valide (P.Eng. – Canada ou PE – États-Unis)
  • Plus de 12 ans d’expérience en conception mécanique dans le cadre de projets EPC/EPCM de traitement des minéraux, avec une progression démontrée vers des rôles senior ou principal.
  • Solide expertise technique en conception, spécification et sélection d’équipements mécaniques majeurs (concasseurs, broyeurs, convoyeurs, pompes, tuyauterie, CVC, etc.).
  • Expérience démontrée en réalisation d’études de faisabilité, conception détaillée et soutien à l’exécution.
  • Maîtrise pratique des logiciels d’ingénierie et d’outils CAO (AutoCAD, Inventor ou équivalent), incluant la capacité d’effectuer des revues et d’encadrer la conception.
  • Bonne connaissance des codes, normes et règlements applicables (ASME, CEMA, CSA, API, etc.).
  • Expérience confirmée en gestion des fournisseurs, développement de lots d’équipement et soutien à l’approvisionnement.
  • Expérience terrain solide : installation, mise en service, dépannage et assistance technique sur site.
  • Capacité démontrée à encadrer et motiver les ingénieurs et concepteurs, tout en contribuant activement aux livrables.
  • Sens commercial développé : aptitude à équilibrer qualité technique, échéancier et budget dans les décisions de projet.
  • Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et communicationnelles, capable de représenter l’entreprise auprès des clients, fournisseurs et intervenants du secteur.

 

Détails du poste:

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidats doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada ou aux États-Unis
  • Salaire compétitif adapté à vos compétences et à votre expérience
  • Assurances payées par Primero dès le premier jour
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution équivalente de l’employeur
  • Jusqu’à 10 jours de congé de maladie payés par année
  • Horaire flexible et possibilité de travail hybride
  • Milieu de travail convivial et décontracté

 

Envoyez votre candidature à: RH@primero.ca
description_text:
Ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e)
Lieu: Canada (Montréal, Toronto, Vancouver, États-Unis)
Type: Permanent à temps plein
Primero offre une opportunité pour un(e) ingénieur(e) principal(e) en mécanique expérimenté(e), souhaitant jouer un rôle clé dans la croissance de nos activités en Amérique du Nord et contribuer de façon significative à l’orientation technique et stratégique de nos projets.
En tant qu’ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e), vous agirez comme expert technique en ingénierie mécanique au sein de Primero. Vous serez responsable de diriger et de réviser des calculs mécaniques complexes, des devis techniques, des fiches techniques, des listes d’équipement (MEL) et des évaluations de fournisseurs. Ce rôle offre une expertise technique avancée et un soutien dans la conception mécanique, l’analyse, la sélection d’équipement, l’exploitation et l’exécution de projets. L’ingénieur(e) mécanique principal(e) veillera à la qualité et à la cohérence de tous les livrables mécaniques pour les études et projets d’ingénierie détaillée en cours, tout en encadrant et soutenant l’équipe. Selon les projets, il pourra également agir à titre de chef de discipline mécanique ou de gestionnaire de secteur sur certains projets miniers. Ce poste relève du chef de discipline – ingénierie mécanique.
Responsabilités principales:
Agir comme qu’experttechnique en ingénierie mécanique sur les projets de Primero Amériques, en veillant à ce que les conceptions respectent les normes de qualité, de sécurité et de performance.
Rester impliqué dans la conception : effectuer et vérifier des calculs détaillés, préparer et réviser les fiches techniques, devis, rapports et dessins.
Diriger les livrables mécaniques complexes liés aux équipements et systèmes majeurs (concasseurs, broyeurs, convoyeurs, CVC, tuyauterie, etc.).
Gérer les lots d’équipements : élaborer les spécifications, évaluer les soumissions, répondre aux questions techniques et coordonner avec les fournisseurs et les clients.
Fournir un encadrement technique aux ingénieurs et aux concepteurs, tout en participant activement à la production des livrables.
Soutenir la conception et la modélisation 3D, encadrer les concepteurs et participer aux revues de modèles au besoin.
Normaliser et améliorer les méthodes, outils et gabarits d’ingénierie pour instaurer les meilleures pratiques au sein de la discipline mécanique.
Offrir un soutien technique à l’approvisionnement : s’assurer que les équipements respectent les exigences techniques et contractuelles, et conseiller sur les mesures d’atténuation des risques.
Participer activement aux phases de construction, d’installation et de mise en service, en résolvant les problèmes techniques sur le terrain et en apportant un soutien pratique au besoin.
Représenter Primero comme expert technique lors des réunions avec les clients, des rencontres techniques et des discussions de l’industrie, afin de renforcer la réputation de l’entreprise comme partenaire technique de confiance
Profil recherché:
Baccalauréat en génie mécanique (maîtrise considérée comme un atout).
Licence d’ingénieur valide (P.Eng. – Canada ou PE – États-Unis)
Plus de 12 ans d’expérience en conception mécanique dans le cadre de projets EPC/EPCM de traitement des minéraux, avec une progression démontrée vers des rôles senior ou principal.
Solide expertise technique en conception, spécification et sélection d’équipements mécaniques majeurs (concasseurs, broyeurs, convoyeurs, pompes, tuyauterie, CVC, etc.).
Expérience démontrée en réalisation d’études de faisabilité, conception détaillée et soutien à l’exécution.
Maîtrise pratique des logiciels d’ingénierie et d’outils CAO (AutoCAD, Inventor ou équivalent), incluant la capacité d’effectuer des revues et d’encadrer la conception.
Bonne connaissance des codes, normes et règlements applicables (ASME, CEMA, CSA, API, etc.).
Expérience confirmée en gestion des fournisseurs, développement de lots d’équipement et soutien à l’approvisionnement.
Expérience terrain solide : installation, mise en service, dépannage et assistance technique sur site.
Capacité démontrée à encadrer et motiver les ingénieurs et concepteurs, tout en contribuant activement aux livrables.
Sens commercial développé : aptitude à équilibrer qualité technique, échéancier et budget dans les décisions de projet.
Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et communicationnelles, capable de représenter l’entreprise auprès des clients, fournisseurs et intervenants du secteur.
Détails du poste:
40 heures par semaine
Les candidats doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada ou aux États-Unis
Salaire compétitif adapté à vos compétences et à votre expérience
Assurances payées par Primero dès le premier jour
Régime de retraite avec contribution équivalente de l’employeur
Jusqu’à 10 jours de congé de maladie payés par année
Horaire flexible et possibilité de travail hybride
Milieu de travail convivial et décontracté
Envoyez votre candidature à
:
RH@primero.ca

title: Quantity Surveyor
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero Can Do for you.

Your Opportunity 

We are looking for a Quantity Surveyor to join our Commercial Team.  Reporting to the Commercial Manager and based in our Perth Head Office, you will be the EPC key interface between relevant stakeholders on all quantity surveying activities.

Your Key Responsibilities 

  • Price/forecast the cost of the different materials needed for the project
  • Track changes to the design and/or construction work and adjusting budget projections accordingly
  • Provide detailed reports concerning the project to Primero management
  • Prepare contracts and documents
  • Set budgets for payments, inventory needs, and materials
  • Analyse costs for maintenance and additional building needs
  • Track changes in plans or constructions; update budgets
  • Negotiate with contractors and subcontractors
  • Identify potential financial or construction risks

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Accreditation in a quantity surveying, commercial management or a related construction subject.
  • 5-10 years of Industrial Construction Project experience, working with a BOQ and Pricing Schedule that spans all disciplines from Bulk Earthworks, Piling, Civil Concrete, Mechanical, Piping, Electrical and Instrumentation
  • Demonstrated experience in auditing Subcontractor quantity progress claims, reconciling tender as contracted BOQ’s against actual installed/consumed quantities
  • Estimating experience, financial experience, construction experience, or related fields
  • Proficient computer and Microsoft Excel skills 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Flexible Working Arrangements 
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits and Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards
  • Onsite Gym (remove for site-based roles)

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

 

APPLY NOW

 If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.
    
Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
    
 Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Principal Process Engineer – Expat Opportunity (Canada/USA)
description_html:
Principal Process Engineer – Expat Opportunity (Canada/USA)

Expat opportunity: North America (Canada / USA)

Location options: Montreal (QC), Toronto (ON), Vancouver (BC) or United States

Type: Permanent, Full-time (40 hours per week)

Relocation / Expat Support Available

 

Build Something Bigger — Take Your Expertise Global

Primero is offering a rare expat opportunity for an experienced Australian Principal Process Engineer who is ready to take their career global and play a key role in growing our North American business.

Founded in Australia in 2011, Primero has built a strong reputation for delivering high-quality EPC/EPCM solutions across the minerals processing sector. Over the past decade, we have successfully expanded into Canada and the United States, with established offices in Montreal, Houston, and Toronto, and a growing pipeline of projects across gold, copper, lithium, and critical minerals.

This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who wants more than just another project role — someone motivated by technical leadership, business growth, and long-term impact.

The Opportunity

As Principal Process Engineer – North America, you will act as a technical expert, helping shape the future of Primero’s process engineering capability across the region.

 

You will work closely with executive leadership, project teams, and clients, contributing not only to complex engineering and studies, but also to strategic growth, mentoring, and business development.

This is a hands-on, influential role with visibility and autonomy — well suited to someone who thrives in an evolving, entrepreneurial environment.

 

Key Responsibilities:

  • Act as the technical expert for metallurgy and mineral processing across North American projects.
  • Lead and review scoping, pre-feasibility, feasibility, and bankable feasibility studies.
  • Provide expert input into process selection, flowsheet development, and optimization.
  • Drive continuous improvement across safety, procedures, training, and operational efficiency.
  • Develop and support computer-based training modules (operations, HSE, laboratory, sampling).
  • Provide project development and engineering management support across mining and minerals projects.
  • Mentor and coach engineers, supporting team development and capability building.
  • Contribute to business development, client engagement, and proposal work as required.
  • Support strategic initiatives including long-term asset optimization, M&A evaluations, and growth planning.

Technical Expertise:

Strong experience across mineral processing circuits, including:

  • Gold, silver, copper, lithium, cobalt and critical minerals
  • Crushing, grinding, screening
  • Flotation (sulphide & oxide)
  • Gravity concentration
  • Dense medium separation (DMS)
  • Thickening, filtration, tailings
  • Laboratory test work and data interpretation

 

What we’re looking for: 

  • Degree qualification in Chemical / Metallurgical / Process Engineering (or equivalent).
  • 15+ years experience across engineering, operations and/or commissioning.
  • Strong background in mineral processing, ideally within EPC/EPCM environments.
  • Proven capability operating at Principal / Technical Expert level.
  • Experience in business development and client relationship management.
  • Strong leadership, mentoring and communication skills.
  • High standards for HSE, quality, and technical excellence.
  • Comfortable working in a fast-growing, evolving organisation.
  • Excellent communication skills required.

Why this role is different

  • Long term opportunity – not just a project assignment
  • Opportunity to influence strategy and growth across North America.
  • Join an Australian-founded company with strong cultural alignment.
  • Work on international, technically challenging projects.
  • Choice of Canada or USA as your base.

What we offer

  • Competitive principal-level salary, aligned to experience.
  • Relocation and expat support (details discussed individually).
  • Comprehensive health insurance from day one.
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching 
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Supportive, collaborative culture with strong Australian roots
  • Active social culture and emphasis on work-life balance

Whether you’re actively looking or just exploring, feel free to reach out for a confidential discussion.

HR@primero.ca

You will work closely with executive leadership, project teams, and clients, contributing not only to complex engineering and design, but also to strategic growth, mentoring, and business development.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Act as the technical expert for mechanical engineering across North American projects.
  • Lead and review mechanical design deliverables across scoping, pre-feasibility, feasibility, and detailed engineering phases.
  • Provide expert input into equipment selection, mechanical layouts, materials handling systems, and plant design.
  • Lead and review mechanical calculations, specifications, datasheets, equipment lists, and technical reports.
  • Support procurement activities including equipment package development, vendor evaluations, and technical bid assessments.

  • Crushing, grinding, and screening equipment
  • Materials handling and conveying systems

  • Bulk solids handling
  • Plant layouts and mechanical integration
  • Equipment installation, commissioning, and troubleshooting
  • Vendor coordination and package management

As Principal Mechanical Engineer – North America, you will act as a technical expert, helping shape the future of Primero’s mechanical engineering capability across the region.
You will work closely with executive leadership, project teams, and clients, contributing not only to complex engineering and design, but also to strategic growth, mentoring, and business development.
This is a hands-on, influential role with visibility and autonomy — well suited to someone who thrives in an evolving, entrepreneurial environment.
Key Responsibilities:
Act as the technical expert for mechanical engineering across North American projects.
Lead and review mechanical design deliverables across scoping, pre-feasibility, feasibility, and detailed engineering phases.
Provide expert input into equipment selection, mechanical layouts, materials handling systems, and plant design.
Lead and review mechanical calculations, specifications, datasheets, equipment lists, and technical reports.
Support procurement activities including equipment package development, vendor evaluations, and technical bid assessments.
Drive continuous improvement across engineering standards, procedures, safety, and quality.
Provide project engineering and execution support across mining and minerals projects.
Mentor and coach engineers and designers, supporting team development and capability building.
Contribute to business development, client engagement, and proposal work as required.
Support strategic initiatives including long-term asset optimization, project risk reviews, and growth planning.
Technical Expertise:
Strong experience across mechanical systems for mineral processing facilities, including:
Crushing, grinding, and screening equipment
Materials handling and conveying systems
Pumps, piping, and mechanical services
Bulk solids handling
Plant layouts and mechanical integration
Equipment installation, commissioning, and troubleshooting
Vendor coordination and package management
What we’re looking for:
Degree qualification in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent).
15+ years’ experience across engineering, project delivery, and/or site support.
Strong background in mechanical design for mining and mineral processing facilities.
Proven capability operating at Principal / Technical Expert level.
Experience within EPC/EPCM project environments.
Experience supporting procurement, vendor management, and site execution.
Strong leadership, mentoring, and communication skills.
High standards for HSE, quality, and technical excellence.
Comfortable working in a fast-growing, evolving organisation.
Excellent communication skills required.

Long term opportunity – not just a project assignment
Opportunity to influence strategy and growth across North America.

Expat opportunity: North America (Canada / USA)

Location options: Montreal (QC), Toronto (ON), Vancouver (BC) or United States

Type: Permanent, Full-time (40 hours per week)

Relocation / Expat Support Available

 

Build Something Bigger — Take Your Expertise Global

Primero is offering a rare expat opportunity for an experienced Principal Mechanical Engineer Engineer who is ready to take their career global and play a key role in growing our North American business.

Founded in Australia in 2011, Primero has built a strong reputation for delivering high-quality EPC/EPCM solutions across the minerals processing sector. Over the past decade, we have successfully expanded into Canada and the United States, with established offices in Montreal, Houston, and Toronto, and a growing pipeline of projects across gold, copper, lithium, and critical minerals.

This role is ideal for an experienced engineer who wants more than just another project role — someone motivated by technical leadership, business growth, and long-term impact.

The Opportunity

As Principal Mechanical Engineer – North America, you will act as a technical expert, helping shape the future of Primero’s mechanical engineering capability across the region.

 

You will work closely with executive leadership, project teams, and clients, contributing not only to complex engineering and design, but also to strategic growth, mentoring, and business development.

This is a hands-on, influential role with visibility and autonomy — well suited to someone who thrives in an evolving, entrepreneurial environment.

  • Support procurement activities including equipment package development, vendor evaluations, and technical bid assessments.
  • Drive continuous improvement across engineering standards, procedures, safety, and quality.

  • Mentor and coach engineers and designers, supporting team development and capability building.
  • Contribute to business development, client engagement, and proposal work as required.
  • Support strategic initiatives including long-term asset optimization, project risk reviews, and growth planning.

Technical Expertise:

Strong experience across mechanical systems for mineral processing facilities, including:

  • Crushing, grinding, and screening equipment
  • Materials handling and conveying systems
  • Pumps, piping, and mechanical services
  • Bulk solids handling
  • Plant layouts and mechanical integration
  • Equipment installation, commissioning, and troubleshooting
  • Vendor coordination and package management

What we’re looking for: 

  • Degree qualification in Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent).

title: Accounts Officer - Part-time
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. 

Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity

We are looking for an Accounts Officer to join our Finance Team at our Head Office in Osborne Park on a part time basis. The role is a 12 month fixed term maternity leave position. We are flexible with the days and hours that suit you, however we would ideally looking for someone who can work 24-32 hours per week. 

Please note this role is additional to the full time role we have recently advertised and since filled. 

Reporting to the Accounts Manager, you will be required to assist the finance team providing accurate and timely processing of all invoices. 

Your Key Responsibilities

Accounts Payable 

  • Manage the AP inbox and respond to supplier queries via phone and email.
  • Process high volumes of invoices, including PO matching, approvals, and payment runs (weekly/monthly)
  • Maintain accurate AP records and ensure proper filing of documentation.
  • Processing subcontractor invoices in align with contract terms
  • Assist with internal and external financial reporting
  • Support general finance tasks as required.
  • Reconcile company credit card transactions and ensure appropriate documentation is collected.
  • Process employee expense claims in line with company policy.
  • Review vendor onboarding requirements and approve supplier bank details.

Accounts Receivable

  • Enter customer invoices, payments, and adjustments.
  • Process intercompany invoices
  • Reconcile income and monitor customer accounts for discrepancies.
  • Follow up on outstanding payments and issue monthly statements.

What You ‘Can Do’

  • 2+ years’ Accounts Payable/Receivable experience.
  • 2+ years’ experience working in a construction, or EPC/M company. (Microsoft Dynamics D365 – desirable).
  • Proven ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously while meeting deadlines and maintaining high accuracy.
  • Capable of working independently with minimal supervision.
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive and solutions-focused approach.
  • Committed to handling sensitive information with discretion and maintaining strict confidentiality.
  • Focused and detail oriented with a high degree of accuracy

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible Working Arrangements 
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Onsite Gym 
  • Osborne Park location

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity 

We are looking for an experienced Senior Electrical Engineer to join the Electrical Engineering team continuing the development and implementation of the E&I functions within Primero. 

This role will initially be commencing onsite on a FIFO 2:1 roster for a period of approximately 6-9 months assisting with Project Engineering duties on one of our large scale Construction projects. 

The role will then return to our head office on a full time, Monday – Friday basis.

 

The successful candidate will have strong demonstrated skills working across both design and project engineering disciplines.

 

 Your Key Responsibilities 

 

Senior Project Engineer (Site Based):

  • Proactively communicate with the electrical superintendents, electrical supervisors and senior engineers and stay abreast of project communication to autonomously develop and manage work tasks and priorities
  • Communicate with the electrical supervisors and leading hands to understand daily construction progress and capture in the QMR to support project tracking
  • Read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation /report.
  • Perform calculations for site modification and general site engineering problem solving using engineering formulas and skills with assistance from Perth office.
  • Compile and maintain workpacks of relevant electrical design information to support construction works by the site electrical team e.g drawings, cable schedules, model shots
  • Provide technical support to the electrical supervisors, leading hands and electricians for execution of the workpacks.
  • Communicate with the design team to resolve issues identified with design information in preparing and executing workpacks
  • Communicate with the planning team to resolve issues identified with data entry into QMR
  • Redline markup design information with site as constructed information where there are differences 
  • Provide engineering support to close out completion of construction activities e.g. participate in walkdowns, ITRs and punch lists documentation
  • Communicate and work with the site project engineers to develop and maintain various trackers with the aim to provide visibility on location and quantity of construction materials, e.g. cables, instruments, equipment
  • Site verification of deliveries and engineering support for orderly storage of construction materials

 

Senior Electrical Engineer (Office Based)

  • Ensure compliance of Electrical and Instrumentation documents and drawings with the company Design Procedure
  • Assist the Lead or Principal Engineer with completing deliverables on time and budget 
  • Produce electrical and instrumentation designs that comply with applicable legislation, standards, client, third party and project requirements.
  • Ensure designs are fit for purpose and consider all aspects including, cost, constructability, operability and maintainability.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (recognised by IEAust).
  • 5+ years’ experience within Electrical Engineering (both project & design).
  • Knowledge and practical application of relevant industry codes of practice.
  • Knowledge and practical application of design theories, principles and practices.
  • Strong level of expertise in technical detail of Electrical Engineering.
  • Knowledge and previous demonstrated experience as a Project Engineer working on construction and commissioning projects in Australia (and overseas).
  • Proven ability to work efficiently and effectively within a multi-discipline environment. 
  • Proven ability to work autonomously or as a part of team. 
  • Strong problem-solving and planning skills. 
  • Demonstrate previous site experience on a major mining/energy construction project. 
  • Commissioning experience desirable. 

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Project Engineer
description_html:
Project Engineers - SMP          

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

 

  • Primero is currently recruiting for a Project Engineer to join a newly awarded project.
  • Based in our Head Office in Osborne Park, you will be contributing to the successful delivery of the project on behalf of our client. 
  • You will be primarily responsible managing commercial buildings and architectural packages.
  • You will be responsible for assisting the Project Manager and Construction Manager in determining priorities, meeting strict deadlines and budget demands whilst having the ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision.  

 

Your Key Responsibilities
 

  • The management of a major design and construct subcontractor modular builder, with scope in a prefabrication facility in Perth and following through to site installation.
  • Field monitoring and management of client inspections at the Perth based pre-fabrication facility and occasional ad-hoc site work.
  • The ability to read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation and/or reports.
  • Previous experience managing and implementing quality control and assurance systems and processes.
  • The capacity to plan, schedule, conduct, and/or coordinate detailed phases of assigned project work.
  • Proficient in Microsoft excel, word and outlook.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

 

  • Significant experience as a Project Engineer on Major Projects.
  • Experience with managing Commercial buildings / Modular Buildings and subcontractors.
  • Experience in multi-discipline, mining project delivery.
  • Ability to read and interpret design drawings, schematics and other engineering drawings.

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

 

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

The ability to read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation and/or reports.
Previous experience managing and implementing quality control and assurance systems and processes.
The capacity to plan, schedule, conduct, and/or coordinate detailed phases of assigned project work.
Proficient in Microsoft excel, word and outlook.
What You ‘Can Do’
Significant experience as a Project Engineer on Major Projects.
Experience with managing Commercial buildings / Modular Buildings and subcontractors.
Experience in multi-discipline, mining project delivery.
Ability to read and interpret design drawings, schematics and other engineering drawings.
What we ‘Can Do’ for you:
Competitive Compensation
Career Opportunities
Paid Parental Leave
Health and Wellbeing Support
Benefits & Discounts
Employee Referral Rewards
If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.
Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.
APPLY NOW
If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first,
please apply now.

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description_html:
Senior Mechanical Engineer

Location: Toronto, ON

Type: Permanent Full-time

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Senior Mechanical Engineer.
This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and rapidly growing in Montreal since 2016. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants. 

Your mission: 

As a Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for mechanical engineering calculations, specifications, datasheets, mechanical equipment list (MEL) and vendor review & recommendation. This role will also provide technical expertise and support in the areas of mechanical engineering design, calculation, operation, maintenance, field execution/supervision and project management as required. The Mechanical Engineer will also be responsible for all other task required to produce the mechanical deliverable for the on-going Studies or Detailed engineering work. This person could be acting as Lead Mechanical Engineer, or Area Manager on specific mining projects. This position is reporting to the Discipline Lead – Mechanical Engineering.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and perform calculations for mechanical equipment and systems (e.g., crushers, mills, conveyors, HVAC, etc.) 
  • Prepare and review engineering deliverables including datasheets, specifications, and technical reports. 
  • Manage equipment packages and coordinate with vendors, clients, and multidisciplinary teams.
  • Provide guidance to draftspersons using CAD tools (AutoCAD Mechanical 2D/3D).
  • Evaluate vendor bids and support procurement decisions.
  • Assess client specifications and recommend design improvements.
  • Oversee equipment installation, commissioning, and provide site support as needed.

What We’re Looking For: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) designation in Ontario is required.
  • 8–12+ years of experience in mechanical design for mining and mineral processing projects
  • Experience with detailed engineering, construction, and commissioning on-site
  • Strong knowledge of mechanical deliverables, industry standards, and engineering codes
  • Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and schematics
  • Additional knowledge in flotation, DMS plants, slurry/liquid pumping, and bulk material handling
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills in English. French is an asset
  • Proficient in CAD and design/navigation tools (an asset)
  • Self-motivated, organized, adaptable, and results-driven

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee, tea, and fresh fruit available daily to keep you energized
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule
  • Modern offices in the heart of Toronto

Apply to: HR@primero.ca

title: Ingénieur(e) en procédés / Process Engineer
description_html:
Ingénieur(e) en procédés

Lieu : Montréal, QC

Type : Permanent à temps plein

 

L'équipe de Groupe Primero Amériques est toujours à la recherche d'un(e) ingénieur(e) en procédés
Il s'agit d'une occasion unique de se joindre à notre talentueuse équipe et de faire partie de la croissance et du succès de Primero. Primero est une entreprise fondée en Australie, fondée en 2011 et en pleine croissance à Montréal depuis 2016. Nous nous spécialisons dans la conception, l'approvisionnement et la gestion de la construction d'usines de traitement des minéraux. La mission de Primero est de devenir la référence en ingénierie dans le traitement du lithium, et nous sommes fiers de contribuer directement à l'électrification des transports mondiaux.

Votre mission :

En tant qu’ingénieur(e) en procédés, vous serez responsable des calculs de procédés, des bilans de masse, de l’établissement des critères de conception, ainsi que du développement des organigrammes de procédés (flow-sheets) et des schémas de tuyauterie et d’instrumentation (P&ID). Vous contribuerez à la conception des procédés et à la production des livrables requis par nos clients, en mettant à profit vos connaissances des méthodes de travail et techniques utilisées dans la conception d’usines de traitement, la réalisation d’études, et la coordination avec les autres disciplines. Vous participerez également au développement et à la mise en œuvre des fonctions métallurgiques de Primero Amériques. Ce poste relève du/de la Responsable de l’ingénierie des procédés.

Responsabilités du poste :

  • Développer des schémas de procédé, P&ID, critères de conception et spécifications techniques
  • Participer à la sélection des équipements et à la planification des procédés
  • Fournir un soutien stratégique aux équipes d’ingénierie et assurer l’alignement avec les objectifs de projet
  • Proposer des solutions métallurgiques et planifier les modifications aux procédés
  • Participer à la gestion des essais, à l’analyse des besoins clients et au suivi de la performance usine
  • Contribuer aux révisions des politiques internes et à la livraison de livrables de qualité dans les délais

Ce que nous recherchons : 

  • Diplôme en génie des procédés, chimique ou métallurgique
  • Membre (ou candidat à l’obtention) du permis d’ingénieur (P.Eng) auprès de l’OIQ ou d’un organisme équivalent
  • 4 à 8 années d’expérience en ingénierie, exploitation et/ou mise en service
  • Expérience en traitement de minerais, raffinage des métaux ou dans des industries connexes;
  • Excellentes capacités d’analyse permettant de résoudre des problèmes complexes;
  • Solides compétences analytiques et grand souci du détail
  • Capacité à collaborer efficacement avec les équipes internes
  • Bonne compréhension des principes HSE et des codes applicables
  • Souplesse et débrouillardise pour gérer les fluctuations de la charge de travail
  • Maîtrise de la lecture de spécifications, de schémas et de dessins techniques
  • Bilingue (français et anglais) avec d’excellentes compétences en communication
  • Engagement à livrer un travail de qualité dans les délais et à offrir un soutien au besoin

 

Détails du poste : 

 

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidat(e)s doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada
  • Salaire compétitif, établi selon vos compétences et votre expérience
  • Couverture d’assurance complète payée par Primero dès l’embauche
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur à hauteur de 5 %
  • Jusqu’à 10 journées de maladie payées par année
  • Code vestimentaire décontracté
  • Café, thé et fruits frais offerts tous les jours pour vous garder en forme
  • Horaire de travail flexible et mode hybride
  • Bureaux modernes situés au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
  • Accès gratuit à une salle de sport
  • Environnement de travail convivial et décontracté avec un comité social actif

Envoyez votre candidature à : RH@primero.ca 

____________________________________________________

Process Engineer

Location: Montreal, QC 

Type: Permanent Full-time

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Process Engineer. 
 This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and rapidly growing in Montreal since 2016. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants. 

Your mission: 

As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for process engineering calculations, mass balances, establishing design criteria, development of flow-sheets and P&IDs. You will help with process design and other deliverable required by our clients by providing sound knowledge and understanding of the work methods and techniques applied in the design of processing facilities, outputs for studies and coordination with other disciplines. You will also help with the development and implementation of the metallurgical functions for Primero Americas.  This position is reporting to the Process Engineering Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop process flow diagrams, P&IDs, design criteria, and technical specifications
  • Support equipment selection and process planning
  • Provide strategic guidance to engineering teams and ensure alignment with project objectives
  • Propose metallurgical solutions and plan process modifications
  • Participate in test work management, client requirement analysis, and plant performance follow-up
  • Contribute to internal policy reviews and ensure timely delivery of high-quality deliverables

What We’re Looking For: 

  • Process/Chemical/Metallurgical Engineering Degree
  • Registered (or candidate for) P. Eng license with the OIQ or equivalent
  • 4 to 8 years’ experience in engineering, operation and/or commissioning works
  • Experience in the mineral processing, metal refining, or related industries;
  • High level of analytical ability used to solve complex problems;
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Effective collaboration with internal teams
  • Solid understanding of HSE principles and applicable codes
  • Flexibility and resourcefulness to manage workload fluctuations
  • Proficient in reading specs, schematics, and engineering drawings
  • Bilingual (French and English) with excellent communication skills
  • Committed to delivering quality work on schedule and providing support as needed

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee, tea, and fresh fruit available daily to keep you energized
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule
  • Modern offices in the heart of downtown Montreal
  • Free gym access
  • Friendly, casual work atmosphere with an active social committee 

Send your application to: HR@primero.ca

Your mission: 

As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for process engineering calculations, mass balances, establishing design criteria, development of flow-sheets and P&IDs. You will help with process design and other deliverable required by our clients by providing sound knowledge and understanding of the work methods and techniques applied in the design of processing facilities, outputs for studies and coordination with other disciplines. You will also help with the development and implementation of the metallurgical functions for Primero Americas.  This position is reporting to the Process Engineering Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop process flow diagrams, P&IDs, design criteria, and technical specifications
  • Support equipment selection and process planning
  • Provide strategic guidance to engineering teams and ensure alignment with project objectives
  • Propose metallurgical solutions and plan process modifications
  • Participate in test work management, client requirement analysis, and plant performance follow-up
  • Contribute to internal policy reviews and ensure timely delivery of high-quality deliverables

What We’re Looking For: 

  • Process/Chemical/Metallurgical Engineering Degree
  • Registered (or candidate for) P. Eng license with the OIQ or equivalent
  • 4 to 8 years’ experience in engineering, operation and/or commissioning works
  • Experience in the mineral processing, metal refining, or related industries;
  • High level of analytical ability used to solve complex problems;
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Effective collaboration with internal teams
  • Solid understanding of HSE principles and applicable codes
  • Flexibility and resourcefulness to manage workload fluctuations
  • Proficient in reading specs, schematics, and engineering drawings
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Committed to delivering quality work on schedule and providing support as needed

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee available daily to keep you energized
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule

Apply to: HR@primero.ca

title: Ingénieur(e) mécanique / Mechanical Engineer
description_html:
Ingénieur(e) mécanique 

Lieu : Montréal, QC

Type : Temps plein, Permanent

 

Groupe Primero Amériques est présentement à la recherche d’un(e) ingénieur(e) mécanique.             
 C’est une occasion unique de rejoindre une équipe talentueuse et de contribuer au succès de Primero. Fondée en Australie en 2011, Primero connaît une croissance constante en Amérique du Nord depuis 2016, avec des bureaux à Montréal, Houston et Toronto. Nous nous spécialisons dans la conception, l'approvisionnement et la gestion de la construction d'usines de traitement de minerais.

Votre mission :

En tant qu’ingénieur(e) mécanique, vous serez responsable des calculs d’ingénierie mécanique, des spécifications techniques, des fiches techniques (datasheets), de la liste des équipements mécaniques (MEL) ainsi que de l’évaluation et des recommandations de fournisseurs. Vous apporterez également une expertise technique et un soutien dans les domaines de la conception mécanique, des calculs, de l’exploitation, de l’entretien, de l’exécution/supervision sur le terrain, ainsi que de la gestion de projet, selon les besoins.

L’ingénieur(e) mécanique sénior sera également responsable de toutes les autres tâches nécessaires à la production des livrables mécaniques dans le cadre des études en cours ou des travaux d’ingénierie détaillée.
 Cette personne pourrait également agir à titre d’ingénieur(e) mécanique en chef ou d’ingénieur(e) responsable de secteur sur certains projets miniers.

Ce poste relève du/de la chef(fe) de discipline – ingénierie mécanique.

Responsabilités du poste :

  • Concevoir et effectuer les calculs relatifs aux équipements et systèmes mécaniques (ex. : concasseurs, broyeurs, convoyeurs, CVAC, etc.)
  • Préparer et réviser les livrables d’ingénierie, y compris les fiches techniques, les spécifications et les rapports techniques.
  • Gérer les lots d’équipements et assurer la coordination avec les fournisseurs, les clients et les équipes pluridisciplinaires.
  • Encadrer les dessinateurs dans la conception à l’aide d’outils de DAO (AutoCAD Mechanical 2D/3D).
  • Évaluer les soumissions des fournisseurs et appuyer les décisions d’approvisionnement.
  • Analyser les spécifications des clients et recommander des améliorations de conception.
  • Superviser l’installation et la mise en service des équipements, et offrir un soutien technique sur site au besoin.

Ce que nous recherchons : 

  • Baccalauréat en génie mécanique
  • Membre d’un ordre professionnel d’ingénieurs ou admissible à l’être (OIQ fortement souhaité)
  • 3 à 7 ans (ou plus) d’expérience en conception mécanique pour des projets dans le secteur minier et le traitement des minéraux
  • Expérience en ingénierie détaillée, construction et mise en service sur site
  • Solide connaissance des livrables mécaniques, des normes de l’industrie et des codes d’ingénierie
  • Capacité à lire et interpréter des dessins techniques et des schémas
  • Connaissances supplémentaires en flottation, usines DMS, pompage de liquides/pulpe, et manutention de matériaux en vrac
  • Excellentes compétences analytiques et grand souci du détail
  • Excellentes compétences en communication, en anglais et en français
  • Maîtrise des outils de conception assistée par ordinateur et de navigation (un atout)
  • Autonomie, sens de l’organisation, adaptabilité et orientation vers les résultats

 

Détails du poste : 

 

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidat(e)s doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada
  • Salaire compétitif, établi selon vos compétences et votre expérience
  • Couverture d’assurance complète payée par Primero dès l’embauche
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur à hauteur de 5 %
  • Jusqu’à 10 journées de maladie payées par année
  • Code vestimentaire décontracté
  • Café, thé et fruits frais offerts tous les jours pour vous garder en forme
  • Horaire de travail flexible et mode hybride
  • Bureaux modernes situés au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
  • Accès gratuit à une salle de sport
  • Environnement de travail convivial et décontracté avec un comité social actif

Cherchez-vous un rôle technique au sein d’une entreprise dynamique qui façonne l’avenir de la réalisation de projets dans le secteur minier et du traitement des minerais ?

Envoyez votre candidature à : RH@primero.ca 

________________________________________________________

Mechanical Engineer

Location: Montreal, QC 

Type: Permanent Full-time

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Mechanical Engineer.
This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and rapidly growing in Montreal since 2016. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants. 

Your mission: 

As a Mechanical Engineer, you will be responsible for mechanical engineering calculations, specifications, datasheets, mechanical equipment list (MEL) and vendor review & recommendation. This role will also provide technical expertise and support in the areas of mechanical engineering design, calculation, operation, maintenance, field execution/supervision and project management as required. The Mechanical Engineer will also be responsible for all other task required to produce the mechanical deliverable for the on-going Studies or Detailed engineering work. This person could be acting as Lead Mechanical Engineer, or Area Manager on specific mining projects. This position is reporting to the Discipline Lead – Mechanical Engineering.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design and perform calculations for mechanical equipment and systems (e.g., crushers, mills, conveyors, HVAC, etc.) 
  • Prepare and review engineering deliverables including datasheets, specifications, and technical reports. 
  • Manage equipment packages and coordinate with vendors, clients, and multidisciplinary teams.
  • Provide guidance to draftspersons using CAD tools (AutoCAD Mechanical 2D/3D).
  • Evaluate vendor bids and support procurement decisions.
  • Assess client specifications and recommend design improvements.
  • Oversee equipment installation, commissioning, and provide site support as needed.

What We’re Looking For: 

  • Bachelor's degree in Mechanical Engineering
  • Member of a professional engineering association or eligible to register (OIQ preferred)
  • 3–7+ years of experience in mechanical design for mining and mineral processing projects
  • Experience with detailed engineering, construction, and commissioning on-site
  • Strong knowledge of mechanical deliverables, industry standards, and engineering codes
  • Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and schematics
  • Additional knowledge in flotation, DMS plants, slurry/liquid pumping, and bulk material handling
  • Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication skills in English and French
  • Proficient in CAD and design/navigation tools (an asset)
  • Self-motivated, organized, adaptable, and results-driven

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee, tea, and fresh fruit available daily to keep you energized
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule
  • Modern offices in the heart of downtown Montreal
  • Free gym access
  • Friendly, casual work atmosphere with an active social committee 

Are you looking for a hands-on role in a fast-paced company that's shaping the future of project delivery in mining and processing?

Send your application to: HR@primero.ca

title: HSE Specialist
description_html:
HSE Specialist

If you re looking for a career with a company that has a  'Can Do'  attitude, then look no further than Primero. We re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a  Can Do  attitude.


About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity

In the HSE Specialist role, you will provide corporate-level HSE technical expertise, governance, and operational support across Primero s projects. You will support the consistent implementation of HSE systems, uplift capability across project teams, and deliver hands-on support to projects as required.


Location: Osborne Park (with site travel as required)


Your Key Responsibilities

* Support and improve Primero's HSE management systems, standards, and procedures

* Lead and support incident investigations, drive quality and corrective action close-out

* Lead and support assurance activities including internal and external audits 

* Coach and develop HSE/site leadership teams through mentoring, training, and in-field support

* Drive critical risk management implementation across all projects

* Analyse HSE data, trends, and reporting to support continuous improvement

* Support project readiness, mobilisation, client engagement, and contractor compliance


What You Can Do

* Tertiary qualification in WHS, OHS, Safety, or related discipline

* Minimum 5-8 years experience in HSE roles within construction, mining, or heavy industry

* Strong knowledge of WHS legislation and industry standards

* Experience with audits, investigations (ICAM), and HSE management systems

* Strong communication and influencing skills

* Ability to work autonomously and manage competing priorities

* High attention to detail and strong analytical capability

* Willingness to travel to project sites as required


Personal Attributes

* Accountability -  Takes ownership and delivers.

* Efficiency - Works smarter and effectively.

* Integrity - Keeps promises and builds trust.


What we Can Do for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.
