title: Superintendent - Commissioning - SMP
description_html:
Commissioning Superintendent – SMP

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


 Your Opportunity

This role is on-site and hands-on, you will play a key role in driving the project’s success.

Reporting to the Manager - Commissioning, you will oversee and manage all activities within your scope, ensuring compliance with health, safety, environmental, and quality standards while delivering on time, within budget, and to Primero’s high standards.


 This role is FIFO on a 2/1 roster.


 Your Key Responsibilities

* Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.

* Ensure that all data requirements for robust projects and financial control are met consistently, completely and on a timely basis as directed by the Manager - Commissioning.

* Directly accountable for setting up the Supervision Team to ensure that all activities are conducted in a safe manner for persons working on the site including sub-contractor’s workforce and visitors

* In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.

* Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issues.

* Analysis production records and coordinate mitigation strategies through review of data.

* Identify and ensure that change management is identified, and all costs associated with rectifying the changes are identified prior to undertaking the work and recorded and communicated with the Project Contracts Team during the undertaking of the works.

* Identify project manning requirements and ensure accurate forecasting of the requirement weekly.

* Monitor, expedite and resolve meeting action items attributed to you.

* Assist in the development and approval of risk assessments.

* Ensure that all personnel working on the site are competent or receive training as deemed necessary to the statutory requirements to carry out the tasks for which they are assigned.

* Ensure all incidents are immediately reported to the project manager and to the client site responsible person. Subsequently provide details of all incidents and the required corrective actions to site personnel.


 What you ‘Can do’      

* Trade/Tertiary/ Suitably Qualified.

* Must have 15+ years’ experience in construction of metallurgical process and/or oil and gas plants.

* Minimum 5+ years at Superintendent level.  

* Exposure to EPC environments is preferred.

* Unwavering commitment to a safety and team first approach.

* Must have current Appointed Persons - Schedule 26 qualifications

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

* Possess a strong understanding of applicable codes of practice.

* Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics and engineering drawings.

* Ability to be sufficiently flexible and resourceful to cope with the inherent load fluctuations of construction projects.

* OSH Construction Industry White/Blue Card (Mandatory).

* Ability to pass a Pre-Employment Medical & Drug and Alcohol Screen.


 What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.
description_text:
Commissioning Superintendent – SMP
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.
About Us
Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.
Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.
Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.
Your Opportunity
This role is on-site and hands-on, you will play a key role in driving the project’s success.
Reporting to the Manager - Commissioning, you will oversee and manage all activities within your scope, ensuring compliance with health, safety, environmental, and quality standards while delivering on time, within budget, and to Primero’s high standards.
This role is FIFO on a 2/1 roster.
Your Key Responsibilities
* Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.
* Ensure that all data requirements for robust projects and financial control are met consistently, completely and on a timely basis as directed by the Manager - Commissioning.
* Directly accountable for setting up the Supervision Team to ensure that all activities are conducted in a safe manner for persons working on the site including sub-contractor’s workforce and visitors
* In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.
* Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issues.
* Analysis production records and coordinate mitigation strategies through review of data.
* Identify and ensure that change management is identified, and all costs associated with rectifying the changes are identified prior to undertaking the work and recorded and communicated with the Project Contracts Team during the undertaking of the works.
* Identify project manning requirements and ensure accurate forecasting of the requirement weekly.
* Monitor, expedite and resolve meeting action items attributed to you.
* Assist in the development and approval of risk assessments.
* Ensure that all personnel working on the site are competent or receive training as deemed necessary to the statutory requirements to carry out the tasks for which they are assigned.
* Ensure all incidents are immediately reported to the project manager and to the client site responsible person. Subsequently provide details of all incidents and the required corrective actions to site personnel.
What you ‘Can do’
* Trade/Tertiary/ Suitably Qualified.
* Must have 15+ years’ experience in construction of metallurgical process and/or oil and gas plants.
* Minimum 5+ years at Superintendent level.
* Exposure to EPC environments is preferred.
* Unwavering commitment to a safety and team first approach.
* Must have current Appointed Persons - Schedule 26 qualifications
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Possess a strong understanding of applicable codes of practice.
* Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics and engineering drawings.
* Ability to be sufficiently flexible and resourceful to cope with the inherent load fluctuations of construction projects.
* OSH Construction Industry White/Blue Card (Mandatory).
* Ability to pass a Pre-Employment Medical & Drug and Alcohol Screen.
What we ‘Can Do’ for you:
* Competitive Compensation
* Career Opportunities
* Paid Parental Leave
* Health and Wellbeing Support
* Benefits & Discounts
* Employee Referral Rewards
If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.
Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.
APPLY NOW
If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.
Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Senior Project Engineer - SMP
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

Primero is currently recruiting for an experienced Senior Project Engineer to join our Construction Project Team on a FIFO 2:1 roster.

In this role, you will be primarily responsible for assisting the Project Manager and Construction Manager in determining priorities, meeting strict deadlines and budget demands whilst also providing guidance and support to the SMP Project Engineering team.

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively communicate with the superintendents, supervisors and project engineers and stay abreast of project communication to autonomously develop and manage work tasks and priorities
  • Communicate with the supervisors and leading hands to understand daily construction progress and capture in the QMR to support project tracking
  • Read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation /report.
  • Perform calculations for site modification and general site engineering problem solving using engineering formulas and skills.
  • Compile and maintain workpacks of relevant information to support construction works by the site SMP team e.g drawings.
  • Provide technical support to the supervisors, leading hands and trades for execution of the workpacks.
  • Communicate with the design team to resolve issues identified with design information in preparing and executing workpacks
  • Communicate with the planning team to resolve issues identified with data entry into QMR
  • Redline markup design information with site as constructed information where there are differences 
  • Provide engineering support to close out completion of construction activities e.g. participate in walkdowns, ITRs and punch lists documentation
  • Communicate and work with the site project engineers to develop and maintain various trackers with the aim to provide visibility on location and quantity of construction materials

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Previous demonstrated experience as a site based Senior Project Engineer on Major Projects.
  • Experience with managing multiple packages and subcontractors.
  • Strong and effective communication and problem-solving skills
  • Previous experience in piping and process plant work would be highly regarded

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

 

APPLY NOW

 

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Procurement Manager
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity 

We are currently recruiting for an experienced Procurement Manager to join our growing corporate team. Reporting to the General Manager- Commercial and Supply Chain, you’ll play a key role in supporting the delivery of the procurement strategy. You’ll work closely with all key stakeholders to deliver procurement outcomes that balance price, quality, reliability, and timeliness.


Your Key Responsibilities 

  • Provide thoughtful leadership and guidance to project sourcing teams, ensuring procurement aligns with business priorities and safety standards.
  • Lead and support strategic sourcing activities, from requirements analysis and specification development to preparing sourcing documentation.
  • Develop and maintain procurement reporting metrics for multiple levels within the business.
  • Define award criteria, select suppliers, and oversee contract execution and handover with a focus on clarity and accountability.
  • Co-create Service Level Agreements with stakeholders, setting clear KPIs and shared goals.
  • Manage the preparation of tender documentation and packs for release to the market for all project supply of materials, fabrication, services and installation as required.
  • Manage the procurement process for all scopes from EOI through to award as determined by the projects ensuring that suppliers, subcontractors and consultants are fully aware of their obligations for project delivery, with the support of the project team disciplines.
  • Maintain awareness and reporting on changing commercial risk profiles throughout the duration of an agreement and or project life cycle.


What You ‘Can Do’

  • Bachelor's degree, as a minimum in a relevant field (Supply Chain, Engineering, Business, Commerce)
  • 10+ years in procurement, supply chain, or commercial roles. (With in the engineering, construction, resources, energy, infrastructure industries is preferred).
  • Minimum 4 plus years’ experience as a Procurement Manager managing small to medium sized teams. 
  • Proven track record in supplier commercial negotiations, contract management, and project delivery.
  • Strong commercial acumen and stakeholder management skills.
  • Analytical evaluation acumen of “whole of business “and procurement reporting.
  • Demonstrating a commitment to HSE through, personal example, leadership and participation in established working practices.


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Commercial Manager
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity 

We are currently recruiting for an experienced Commercial Manager to join our growing team. Reporting to the General Manager- Commercial and Supply Chain, you will be responsible for managing a project specific commercial and procurement team ensuring the administration, financial and contractual outcomes of a project whilst optimising project margin and protecting the business from commercial risks and maintaining Primero’s high credibility. 

Your Key Responsibilities 

  • Maintaining a comprehensive working knowledge of the head contract and of the precedent forms of contract.
  • Ensuring that all notices are administered in accordance with specified timing requirements.
  • Completing all contract administration tasks in a timely, accurate and efficient manner consistent with industry practice, the business processes and procedures and project requirements.
  • Maintaining awareness and reporting on the changing commercial risk throughout the duration of the project life cycle.
  • Managing the project start-up requirements with the preparation of template documents, system implementation, commercial induction packs and other procedural requirements 
  • Ensure timely issuance of insurance certificates to the client and all insurances remain compliant for subcontractors.
  • Managing the reporting of all commercial and procurement risks across the project
  • Managing the preparation, assessment and submission of progress claims to client and progress schedules to the subcontractor’s ensuring compliance with Security of Payment legislation.
  • Management and submission of head contract variation requests, extension of times, and delay and disruption claims in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract, ensuring strict compliance within requisite timeframes.
  • Managing the review and determination of all subcontract variations requests, extension of times and delay and disruption claims and finalised variations in accordance with the terms and conditions of the contract, ensuring strict compliance within requisite timeframes.
  • Manage the commercial closeout of all assigned contracts across the project ensure release and waivers provide where appropriate and all lessons learned are recorded.
  • Managing the preparation of tender documentation and packs for release to the market for all project supply of materials, fabrication, services and installation as required.
  • Management of the procurement process for all scopes from EOI through to award as determined by the projects.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Relevant degree or tertiary qualification.
  • Minimum 15 years’ experience in procurement and contract administration within the construction industry 
  • Minimum 4 years’ experience working as a Commercial Manager in the construction industry. 
  • Strong communication skills with the ability to convey messages clearly and effectively through various means, including verbal, non-verbal and written forms.
  • Demonstrated ability to analyse contractual / legal issues and provide solutions through appropriate problem solving techniques.
  • Sound commercial acumen accompanied by proven negotiation and inter-relationship skills evidenced by effective dispute resolutions.
  • Demonstrating a commitment to HSE through, personal example, leadership and participation in established working practices

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Lead - Permits and Isolations
description_html:
Lead - Permits & Isolations

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity


Roster: 2:1 | Billion-Dollar Gold Project


Join a high-performing team on a landmark billion-dollar gold project. As the Lead – Permits & Isolations, you’ll be responsible for managing the end-to-end process of issuing work permits and implementing isolations across all energy sources. You’ll play a critical role in ensuring that all work is carried out safely, by authorised personnel, with the correct permits and isolations in place—minimising risk to all field teams on site.


Your Key Responsibilities

* Implement Permit and Isolation Procedures

Apply and maintain Primero’s procedures for issuing work permits, conducting isolations, and managing lockout/tagout processes.

* Manage the Permit-to-Work System

Oversee the full lifecycle of the permit-to-work process, including application, review, approval, and closeout.

* Coordinate and Conduct Isolations

Ensure isolations are correctly implemented for all relevant equipment and systems prior to the commencement of work.

* Train and Supervise Personnel

Deliver training and provide ongoing support to staff involved in the permit and isolation process.

* Monitor and Audit Compliance

Conduct regular audits to ensure adherence to isolation and permit procedures.

* Incident Investigation

Participate in investigations of any incidents related to permits or isolations, identifying root causes and improvement opportunities.

* Maintain Accurate Records

Keep comprehensive records of permits issued, isolations implemented, and training completed.

* Liaise with Stakeholders

Communicate effectively with operations, maintenance, and HSE personnel to coordinate safe work activities.

* Ensure Regulatory Compliance

Guarantee that all work is carried out in line with relevant legislation, industry standards, and company policies.


What You ‘Can Do’

Skills & Experience

* Strong technical understanding of industrial or construction environments and relevant safety regulations

* Expertise in permit-to-work systems and isolation procedures

* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to engage with multi-disciplinary teams

* Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities

* Proven leadership and supervisory capabilities

* High attention to detail to ensure process accuracy and safety

* Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role


Qualifications

* WA Electrical Licence

* High Voltage Switching Accreditation (within the last 2 years)

* Confined Space Awareness

* Atmospheric Gas Testing

* Hot Work Principles


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Stage ingénierie de procédés / Process Engineering internship
description_html:
Primero est à la recherche d’un(e) stagiaire en génie de procédés prêt(e) à apprendre, contribuer et évoluer avec nous. Fondée en Australie en 2011, notre équipe de Montréal connaît une croissance rapide depuis 2016. Nous sommes spécialisés en conception, approvisionnement et gestion de construction d’usines de traitement de minerais, avec un fort accent sur l’industrie du lithium et l’électrification des transports à l’échelle mondiale. 

Ce stage est une réelle opportunité de développer tes compétences dans un environnement concret, tout en contribuant à des projets stimulants et d’envergure. Chez Primero, on valorise l’efficacité, la responsabilité et l’intégrité, et on sait aussi avoir du plaisir en livrant des résultats solides.

Votre mission, si vous l’acceptez :

Soutenir notre équipe en ingénierie de procédés dans la conception technique de procédés, les calculs et la gestion de projet, au besoin, sous la supervision de notre directrice des procédés.

Ce que vous ferez:

  • Aider la préparation de bilans de masse, calculs et dimensionnement d’équipements.
  • Participer à la rédaction de fiches techniques, rapports et documents d’ingénierie.
  • Soutenir l’équipe de conception dans le développement de schémas de procédé (PFD/P&ID) et l’utilisation d’outils DAO.
  • Collaborer avec les ingénieurs et techniciens pour assurer la qualité des livrables.
  • Assister aux réunions d’équipe et participer à la préparation de présentations et de rapports d’avancement.

Profil recherché:

  • En dernière année d’un baccalauréat en génie chimique ou en génie du traitement des minéraux
  • Intérêt marqué pour la conception de procédés et le secteur minier
  • Curieux(se), rigoureux(se) et motivé(e) à apprendre dans un environnement dynamique
  • À l’aise avec Microsoft Office; connaissance des PFD, P&ID ou logiciels de simulation est un atout
  • Bilingue (français/anglais), un atout majeur
  • Capacité à analyser, résoudre des problèmes et travailler en équipe
  • Disponible pour travailler en présentiel à notre bureau de Montréal, du lundi au vendredi

Conditions du stage:

  • Stage rémunéré à temps plein (environ 15 semaines) – Printemps 2026
  • Doit être reconnu comme stage universitaire dans ton programme d’études
  • Les candidat(e)s doivent avoir le droit légal de travailler au Canada
  • Comité social, ambiance décontractée, café de qualité et fruits frais tous les jours
  • Possibilité d’emploi à temps plein après le stage

Pour postuler:

Envoyez votre CV et une courte lettre de présentation à RH@primero.ca 

_________________________________________________________________

Primero is looking for a Process Engineering Intern who’s ready to learn, contribute, and grow with us. Founded in Australia in 2011, our Montreal team has been growing rapidly since 2016. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants, with a strong focus on the lithium industry and the global shift toward transport electrification.

This internship is a real opportunity to develop your skills in a hands-on environment while contributing to exciting and large-scale projects. At Primero, we value efficiency, accountability, and integrity—and we know how to have fun while delivering solid results.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:

Support our process engineering team in technical design, calculations, and project support as needed, under the supervision of our Process Manager.

What you'll do:

  • Assist in the preparation of mass balances, calculations, and equipment sizing.
  • Help draft technical data sheets, reports, and engineering documents.
  • Support the design team in developing process flow diagrams (PFDs), piping and instrumentation diagrams (P&IDs), and using CAD tools.
  • Collaborate with engineers and technicians to ensure the quality of deliverables.
  • Attend team meetings and help prepare presentations and progress reports

What we’re looking for:

  • Final year of a bachelor’s degree in Chemical Engineering or Mineral Processing Engineering 
  • Strong interest in process design and the mining sector
  • Curious, detail-oriented, and motivated to learn in a dynamic environment 
  • Comfortable using Microsoft Office; knowledge of PFDs, P&IDs or simulation tools is a plus 
  • À l’aise avec Microsoft Office; connaissance des PFD, P&ID ou logiciels de simulation est un atout
  • Bilingual (French/English) is a strong asset 
  • Strong analytical, teamwork and problem-solving skills 
  • Available to work in person at our Montreal office, Monday to Friday

 

Internship details:

  • Paid full-time internship (approximately 15 weeks) – Spring 2026
  • Must be eligible for academic credit within your university program
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Social committee, casual atmosphere, quality coffee and fresh fruit every day
  • Potential for full-time employment after the internship

To apply:

Send your resume and a short cover letter to HR@primero.ca

title: Completions Engineer
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity

We are currently recruiting for a Completions Engineer to join a landmark billion-dollar gold project working a 2:1 roster and playing a pivotal role in bringing a world-class project to completion. You’ll be at the forefront of managing close-out schedules, compiling critical handover documentation, and ensuring the highest quality standards are met—all while delivering a defect-free, on-budget project that meets contractual requirements.

Working closely with expert teams and stakeholders to ensure smooth client handover you will strong focus on risk mitigation and continuous improvement.

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Project Completion: Manage the completion and close-out schedule, ensuring all works are completed within contractual timeframes. 
  • Documentation: Compile and manage handover documentation progressively, ensuring timely completion within contractual requirements. 
  • Quality Assurance: Ensure all works are defect-free and meet the required quality standards. 
  • Client Handover: Facilitate the successful handover of the completed project to the client. 
  • Collaboration: Collaborate with project teams and stakeholders to ensure timely and efficient completion of the project. 
  • Risk Management: Identify and mitigate potential risks related to project completion. 
  • Budget Management: Monitor and manage project completion costs, ensuring adherence to the budget. 
  • Continuous Improvement: Contribute to project reviews and lessons learned to identify areas for improvement in future projects. 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Experience: Proven experience in completions management, within the mineral processing construction projects: gold project experience is preferred. 
  • Knowledge: Strong understanding of construction processes, quality control procedures, and handover documentation. 
  • Skills: Excellent communication, organisational, and problem-solving skills. 
  • Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field or equivalent experience. 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Career Opportunities 
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Senior Electrical Project Engineer
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

Primero is currently recruiting for an experienced Senior Electrical Project Engineer to join our Construction Project Team in Karratha on a FIFO 2:1 roster.

In this role, you will be primarily responsible for assisting the Project Manager and Construction Manager in determining priorities, meeting strict deadlines and budget demands whilst also providing guidance and support to the Electrical & Instrumentation Project Engineering team.

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively communicate with the superintendents, supervisors and project engineers and stay abreast of project communication to autonomously develop and manage work tasks and priorities
  • Communicate with the supervisors and leading hands to understand daily construction progress and capture in the QMR to support project tracking
  • Read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation /report.
  • Perform calculations for site modification and general site engineering problem solving using engineering formulas and skills.
  • Compile and maintain workpacks of relevant information to support construction works by the site SMP team e.g drawings.
  • Provide technical support to the supervisors, leading hands and trades for execution of the workpacks.
  • Communicate with the design team to resolve issues identified with design information in preparing and executing workpacks
  • Communicate with the planning team to resolve issues identified with data entry into QMR
  • Redline markup design information with site as constructed information where there are differences 
  • Provide engineering support to close out completion of construction activities e.g. participate in walkdowns, ITRs and punch lists documentation
  • Communicate and work with the site project engineers to develop and maintain various trackers with the aim to provide visibility on location and quantity of construction materials

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Previous demonstrated experience as a site based Senior Project Engineer on Major Projects.
  • Previous experience providing oversight, guidance and support to Project Engineers
  • Experience with managing multiple packages and subcontractors.
  • Strong and effective communication and problem-solving skills
  • Previous experience in piping and process plant work would be highly regarded

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

 

APPLY NOW

 

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

Experience with managing multiple packages and subcontractors.
Strong and effective communication and problem-solving skills
Previous experience in piping and process plant work would be highly regarded
What we ‘Can Do’ for you:
Competitive Compensation
Career Opportunities
Paid Parental Leave
Health and Wellbeing Support
Benefits & Discounts
Employee Referral Rewards
If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.
Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.
APPLY NOW
If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.
Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Senior Site Planner
description_html:
Senior Site Planner

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude. 


 About Us 


Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 


 Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


 Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


 Your Opportunity

* Roster: 2:1

* Comply with all Primero procedures, standards, and processes, while also identifying areas for improvement.

* Assist with the development of a detailed execution schedule(s) based on the scope of works.

* Assist with the development of comprehensive basis of schedule documents outlining schedule assumptions, construction sequencing, calendars, weather, resources, equipment, and critical path information

* Coordinate and maintain design and constructability reviews, and integration between disciplines and contractors in the design office and onsite.

* Contribute to planning meetings, understanding the interface and deliverables of package owners in the development process to validate the integrity of the plan, understand the key risk and opportunities.

* Identify, record, analyse, monitor, and report the impact of any deviations and or changes with focus on key drivers of deviations and early trends.

* Meet all role specific HSE responsibilities, accountabilities and KPIs as per the Primero HSE Management procedures and plans.


 What You ‘Can Do’

* University degree preferred (Engineering or similar discipline), but not essential.

* 5-10 Years Experience in a project planning essential

* Experience with EPC Projects advantageous

* Experience in Construction & Engineering, particularly in the Resources & Mining Industries.

* Demonstrated understanding of Critical Path analysis and Extension of Time claims.

* Primavera P6 proficiency is essential

* Strong statistical and analytical reporting skills

* Strong proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and PowerBI


 What we ‘Can Do’ for you: 

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Flexible Working Arrangements 

* Career Opportunities

* Paid Parental Leave 

* Health and Wellbeing Support 

* Benefits & Discounts 

* Employee Referral Rewards 


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you. 


 Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you. 


 APPLY NOW 


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now. 


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

 

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Ingénieur(e) de structure / Structural Engineer
description_html:
Ingénieur(e) de structure

Lieu : Montréal (Québec)

Type: Temps plein, permanent

Échelle salariale: 75,000$ - 100,000$

 

L’équipe de Primero Amériques est actuellement à la recherche d’un(e) ingénieur(e) de structure.

Il s’agit d’une occasion unique de rejoindre une équipe talentueuse et de contribuer à la croissance et au succès de Primero. Fondée en Australie en 2011, Primero connaît une croissance soutenue à Montréal depuis 2016. Nous avons élargi notre présence en Amérique du Nord avec l’ouverture d’un bureau à Houston en 2022, puis à Toronto en 2023. Nous nous spécialisons en conception, approvisionnement et gestion de construction d’usines de traitement des minerais.

En tant qu’ ingénieur(e) de structure, vous serez responsable de la conception de structures et de fondations en acier et en béton conformément aux exigences des projets, sous la supervision de l’ingénieur en chef - structure (CSA Lead). Le rôle implique l’application de principes d’ingénierie spécialisés et avancés à un niveau détaillé et la communication claire des exigences de conception à l’équipe de dessin.

Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans la livraison de conceptions sécuritaires, efficaces et constructibles pour des projets miniers et industriels multidisciplinaires, en contribuant à la préparation des calculs, plans et spécifications techniques, et en collaborant étroitement avec les équipes de génie mécanique, civil et procédés.

 

Responsabilités principales:

  • Appliquer une solide compréhension des principes d’ingénierie pour proposer des solutions pratiques et économiques.
  • Travailler aux côtés d’ingénieur(es) sénior sur des projets de petite, moyenne et grande envergure, incluant : estimations de coûts, soumissions, documentation technique, planification et respect des échéanciers et budgets.
  • Collaborer efficacement avec les autres disciplines de conception (électrique, mécanique, etc.).
  • Veiller à ce que les activités d’ingénierie soient réalisées conformément aux exigences du projet et aux normes techniques de Primero.
  • S’assurer du respect de toutes les exigences réglementaires et législatives.
  • Promouvoir une forte culture SST et démontrer un engagement personnel envers l’objectif de Primero de « zéro incident ».
  • Appuyer les chargé(es) de projet afin d’affecter les ressources appropriées (quantité et profils) pour exécuter les mandats de manière professionnelle.
  • Promouvoir activement et communiquer en continu les meilleures pratiques d’ingénierie au sein des projets, de l’entreprise et du marché.
  • Développer, améliorer et mettre en œuvre des mécanismes de revue afin de capter et exécuter les améliorations de la qualité des livrables.
  • Une expérience en travaux de génie civil constitue un atout.

 

Profil recherché:

  • Baccalauréat en génie civil ou en génie des structures.
  • Membre de l’Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ).
  • Bilinguisme français/anglais.
  • 3 à 5 ans d’expérience pertinente en milieu minier, en traitement des minerais ou en hydrocarbures.
  • Solide connaissance des codes, normes et bonnes pratiques de l’industrie.
  • Excellente compréhension des théories, principes et calculs en conception des structures.
  • Maîtrise des logiciels de conception et d’analyse et capacité à interpréter des dessins d’ingénierie multidisciplinaires (mécanique, tuyauterie, équipements, etc.).
  • Excellentes aptitudes de communication écrite et orale et grand souci du détail.
  • Capacité à assimiler rapidement les exigences des clients et des projets.
  • Solides compétences en gestion du temps et organisation, à l’aise avec des priorités multiples.
  • Fort engagement envers la sécurité, la qualité, le respect des échéanciers et du budget.
  • Proactivité, esprit d’équipe et motivation, avec de fortes habiletés interpersonnelles.

 

Détails du poste:

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidats(es) doivent être autorisés(ées) à travailler au Canada
  • Salaire compétitif selon votre profil
  • Assurances collectives payées par Primero dès le premier jour
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur à 5 %
  • Jusqu’à 10 jours de congé maladie payés par année
  • Code vestimentaire décontracté
  • Café, thé et fruits frais offerts quotidiennement
  • Horaire flexible et possibilité de travail hybride
  • Bureaux modernes au centre-ville de Montréal
  • Accès gratuit au gym de l’immeuble
  • Ambiance conviviale avec un comité social actif

Merci de votre intérêt ! Seuls les profils retenus seront contactés.

Envoyez votre candidature à : RH@primero.ca

__________________________________

Structural Engineer   

Location: Montreal, QC 

Type: Permanent Full-time

Salary Range: 75K – 100k

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Structural Engineer.   
 This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and growing consistently in Montreal since 2016. We expanded into Houston in 2022 and Toronto in 2023, strengthening our North American presence. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants.

The Structural Engineer will be responsible for the design of steel and concrete structures and foundations in accordance with project requirements, working under the supervision of the Lead Structural Engineer. This role involves applying specialized and advanced engineering principles at a detailed level and ensuring that design requirements are clearly communicated to the drafting team.

You’ll play a key role in delivering safe, efficient, and constructible designs across multidisciplinary mining and industrial projects, contributing to the preparation of calculations, drawings, and technical specifications while collaborating closely with mechanical, civil, and process engineering teams.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Apply a solid understanding of Engineering principles to devise and deliver practical and economical solutions to problems
  • Work alongside Senior and Lead Engineers for small, medium and large-scale projects. This will include: participating in cost estimates, tender submissions, technical documentation, project scheduling and meeting deadlines and budgets.
  • Working effectively with other design disciplines, e.g. electrical, mechanical.
  • Ensuring engineering activities are performed in accordance with the project requirements and Primero's technical standards.
  • Ensure that all regulatory and legislative requirements are met in all instances.
  • Promote a strong safety culture and demonstrate your personal commitment to safety to ensure that all activities embrace Primero`s goal of "zero harm".
  • Assist Project Managers with appropriate project resources, both quantity and skill sets, to undertake all contracted works professionally.
  • Actively promote and continuously communicate on the best engineering practices both in the project, the broader business and the marketplace.
  • Develop, improve and implement review mechanisms to capture and execute improvements to the quality of work produced.
  • Experience in civil works is an asset.

 

What We’re Looking For: 

  • Bachelor’s degree in Civil or Structural Engineering.
  • Member of the Ordre des ingénieurs du Québec (OIQ).
  • Bilingual – fluent in French and English.
  • 3–5 years of relevant experience in mining, mineral processing, or hydrocarbons.
  • Solid knowledge of industry codes, standards, and best practices.
  • Strong understanding of structural design theories, principles, and calculations.
  • Proficiency with design and analysis software and ability to interpret multidisciplinary engineering drawings (mechanical, piping, equipment, etc.).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills with strong attention to detail.
  • Ability to assimilate client and project requirements quickly and accurately.
  • Demonstrated time management and organizational skills, capable of handling multiple priorities.
  • High commitment to safety, quality, schedule, and budget control.
  • Proactive, collaborative, and motivated with a positive attitude and strong interpersonal skills.

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee, tea, and fresh fruit available daily 
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule
  • Modern offices in the heart of downtown Montreal
  • Free gym access
  • Friendly, casual work atmosphere with an active social committee 

 

Thank you for your interest! Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Send your application to: HR@primero.ca

title: Concepteur(trice) structure sénior / Senior Structural Designer
description_html:
Concepteur(trice) structure sénior

Lieu: Montréal, QC

Type : Permanent à temps plein

Échelle salariale : 100 000 $ à 135 000 $ CAD par année.

 

L'équipe de Groupe Primero Amériques est présentement à la recherche d'un(e) concepteur(trice) structure sénior. Il s'agit d'une occasion unique de se joindre à notre talentueuse équipe et de faire partie de la croissance et du succès de Primero. Primero est une entreprise fondée en Australie, fondée en 2011 et en pleine croissance à Montréal depuis 2016. Nous nous spécialisons dans la conception, l'approvisionnement et la gestion de la construction d'usines de traitement des minéraux. La mission de Primero est de devenir la référence en ingénierie dans le traitement du lithium, et nous sommes fiers de contribuer directement à l'électrification des transports mondiaux.

Your mission: 

As a Senior Structural Designer, you will be responsible for the development of structural (steel and concrete) 3D models, general arrangements, 2D detailed drawings, and preparation of material take-offs in accordance with project requirements under the supervision of Project Lead Structural Designer. This person will work closely with designers of other disciplines and is responsible for all drafting deliverables related to structural discipline. He/she will need to apply industry standards and /or engineering principles at a conceptual level.

Responsabilités du poste:

 

  • Élaborer des dessins 2D et des modèles 3D conformément aux normes techniques et aux spécifications du projet.
  • S’assurer que la conception, le dessin et la modélisation respectent les procédures de l’entreprise ainsi que les exigences du projet.
  • Vérifier les dessins détaillés et les modèles (format, ajustement et dimensions).
  • Assurer la coordination interdisciplinaire afin que les livrables répondent aux objectifs, aux fonctions et aux normes du projet.
  • Appliquer des compétences en gestion du temps pour respecter les échéanciers et les calendriers du projet.
  • Effectuer le travail avec diligence et dans les délais impartis, en mettant l’accent sur la sécurité au travail et la sécurité dans les conceptions.
  • Participer au développement de solutions innovantes en matière de conception, de flux de travail et de procédures.
  • Respecter toutes les responsabilités, obligations et indicateurs de performance (KPI) en matière de SST propres au rôle, tels que décrits dans le Manuel du système de gestion SST de Primero.

 

Ce que nous recherchons : 

  • Plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie du traitement des minéraux ou dans une autre industrie lourde similaire appliquant la conception structurale.
  • Diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) ou diplôme d’études collégiales (ou supérieur) en dessin technique ou dans un domaine connexe. Une expérience pertinente dans l’industrie sera également considérée.
  • Expérience dans le développement de plans d’aménagement, de dessins détaillés, de modélisation 3D et dans la réalisation de projets multidisciplinaires.
  • Forte aptitude à la résolution de problèmes techniques et capacité à développer de manière autonome des concepts de conception à partir de données d’ingénierie générales.
  • Bonne connaissance de la modélisation des données du bâtiment (BIM) et des flux de travail 3D, privilégiant l’intention de conception plutôt que le dessin 2D traditionnel.
  • Excellente compréhension des normes structurales (impériales et métriques), des meilleures pratiques et des codes de conception régionaux.
  • Respect des normes et procédures de dessin de l’entreprise.
  • Expertise ou familiarité avec Autodesk Advance Steel et AutoCAD. Les concepteurs expérimentés maîtrisant d’autres suites logicielles sont encouragés à postuler. La maîtrise de Revit constitue un atout.
  • Produire un travail de haute qualité, clair et efficace.
  • Démontrer d’excellentes habiletés de communication orale et écrite (français et anglais).
  • Grande attention aux détails et souci de finaliser les livrables.
  • Capacité à travailler de façon autonome.
  • Motivation à apprendre et à acquérir de nouvelles expériences.
  • Capacité à gérer le stress et à s’adapter aux changements constants.

 

Détails du poste:

  • 40 heures par semaine
  • Les candidat(e)s doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada
  • Salaire compétitif, établi selon vos compétences et votre expérience
  • Couverture d’assurance complète payée par Primero dès l’embauche
  • Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur à hauteur de 5 %
  • Jusqu’à 10 journées de maladie payées par année
  • Code vestimentaire décontracté
  • Café, thé et fruits frais offerts tous les jours pour vous garder en forme
  • Horaire de travail flexible et mode hybride
  • Bureaux modernes situés au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
  • Accès gratuit à une salle de sport
  • Environnement de travail convivial et décontracté avec un comité social actif

 

Pour postuler :

Envoyez votre CV à l’adresse suivante : RH@primero.ca 

Nous vous remercions sincèrement de l’intérêt que vous portez à notre équipe. 
 Bien que toutes les candidatures soient examinées avec attention, seules les personnes retenues pour une entrevue seront contactées.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Senior Structural Designer

Location: Montreal, QC

Type: Permanent Full-time

Salary range: $100,000 – $135,000 CAD per year.

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Senior Structural Designer.
This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and rapidly growing in Montreal since 2016. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants. Primero’s mission is to become the engineering reference in lithium processing, and we are proud to contribute directly to the electrification of global transportation.

Your mission: 

As a Senior Structural Designer, you will be responsible for the development of structural (steel and concrete) 3D models, general arrangements, 2D detailed drawings, and preparation of material take-offs in accordance with project requirements under the supervision of Project Lead Structural Designer. This person will work closely with designers of other disciplines and is responsible for all drafting deliverables related to structural discipline. He/she will need to apply industry standards and /or engineering principles at a conceptual level.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Develop 2D drawings and 3D models according to project’s technical standards and technical specifications.
  • Ensure design, drafting and modelling comply with company procedures and project requirements.
  • Drafting checking (format, fit and dimensional) of detailed drawings and models.
  • Inter-discipline coordination to ensure deliverables meet the intended purpose, functions and standards of the project.
  • Apply time management skills to ensure project timelines and schedules are met.
  • Complete work in a timely fashion with a diligent attitude, while focusing on safety during work and safety in designs.
  • Participation in innovative solutions for designs, workflow, and procedures.
  • Meet all role-specific HSE responsibilities, accountabilities and KPIs detailed in the Primero HSE Management System Manual

 

What We’re Looking For: 

  • 10+ years experience in the mineral processing industry or any similar heavy industry practicing structural design.
  • Vocational Diploma (DEP) or Associate Degree (or higher) in General Drafting or a related field. Relevant industry experience will also be considered.
  • Experience in development of layouts, detail drawings, 3D modelling, and experience with multidisciplinary projects.
  • Strong aptitude for technical problem-solving and the ability to independently develop design concepts from high-level engineering inputs
  • Familiarity with Building Information Modelling (BIM) and using 3D workflows, prioritizing design intent over traditional 2D drafting.
    • High level understanding of structural standards (both imperial and metric), best practices, and regional design codes.  
    • Adherence to company drafting standards and procedures.
    • Expertise or familiarity with Autodesk Advance Steel and AutoCAD. Skilled designers proficient in other software suites are encouraged to apply. Revit proficiency is a plus.
    • Produces high quality work that is clear and efficient.
    • Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills. (French and English).
    • Focused on details and closing out works.
    • Ability to work independently.
    • Driven to learn, gain new experience.
    • Ability to handle stress and demands of continuous change.

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee, tea, and fresh fruit available daily to keep you energized
  • Flexible, hybrid work schedule
  • Modern offices in the heart of downtown Montreal
  • Free gym access
  • Friendly, casual work atmosphere with an active social committee

 

To apply:

Send your resume to HR@primero.ca

We truly appreciate your interest in joining our team.  
While we review all applications carefully, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
description_text:
Concepteur(trice) structure sénior
Lieu: Montréal, QC
Type : Permanent à temps plein
Échelle salariale : 100 000 $ à 135 000 $ CAD par année.
L'équipe de Groupe Primero Amériques est présentement à la recherche d'un(e) concepteur(trice) structure sénior.
Il s'agit d'une occasion unique de se joindre à notre talentueuse équipe et de faire partie de la croissance et du succès de Primero. Primero est une entreprise fondée en Australie, fondée en 2011 et en pleine croissance à Montréal depuis 2016. Nous nous spécialisons dans la conception, l'approvisionnement et la gestion de la construction d'usines de traitement des minéraux. La mission de Primero est de devenir la référence en ingénierie dans le traitement du lithium, et nous sommes fiers de contribuer directement à l'électrification des transports mondiaux.
Your mission:
As a Senior Structural Designer,
you will be responsible for the development of structural (steel and concrete) 3D models, general arrangements, 2D detailed drawings, and preparation of material take-offs in accordance with project requirements under the supervision of Project Lead Structural Designer. This person will work closely with designers of other disciplines and is responsible for all drafting deliverables related to structural discipline. He/she will need to apply industry standards and /or engineering principles at a conceptual level.
Responsabilités du poste:
Élaborer des dessins 2D et des modèles 3D conformément aux normes techniques et aux spécifications du projet.
S’assurer que la conception, le dessin et la modélisation respectent les procédures de l’entreprise ainsi que les exigences du projet.
Vérifier les dessins détaillés et les modèles (format, ajustement et dimensions).
Assurer la coordination interdisciplinaire afin que les livrables répondent aux objectifs, aux fonctions et aux normes du projet.
Appliquer des compétences en gestion du temps pour respecter les échéanciers et les calendriers du projet.
Effectuer le travail avec diligence et dans les délais impartis, en mettant l’accent sur la sécurité au travail et la sécurité dans les conceptions.
Participer au développement de solutions innovantes en matière de conception, de flux de travail et de procédures.
Respecter toutes les responsabilités, obligations et indicateurs de performance (KPI) en matière de SST propres au rôle, tels que décrits dans le Manuel du système de gestion SST de Primero.
Ce que nous recherchons :
Plus de 10 ans d’expérience dans l’industrie du traitement des minéraux ou dans une autre industrie lourde similaire appliquant la conception structurale.
Diplôme d’études professionnelles (DEP) ou diplôme d’études collégiales (ou supérieur) en dessin technique ou dans un domaine connexe. Une expérience pertinente dans l’industrie sera également considérée.
Expérience dans le développement de plans d’aménagement, de dessins détaillés, de modélisation 3D et dans la réalisation de projets multidisciplinaires.
Forte aptitude à la résolution de problèmes techniques et capacité à développer de manière autonome des concepts de conception à partir de données d’ingénierie générales.
Bonne connaissance de la modélisation des données du bâtiment (BIM) et des flux de travail 3D, privilégiant l’intention de conception plutôt que le dessin 2D traditionnel.
Excellente compréhension des normes structurales (impériales et métriques), des meilleures pratiques et des codes de conception régionaux.
Respect des normes et procédures de dessin de l’entreprise.
Expertise ou familiarité avec Autodesk Advance Steel et AutoCAD. Les concepteurs expérimentés maîtrisant d’autres suites logicielles sont encouragés à postuler. La maîtrise de Revit constitue un atout.
Produire un travail de haute qualité, clair et efficace.
Démontrer d’excellentes habiletés de communication orale et écrite (français et anglais).
Grande attention aux détails et souci de finaliser les livrables.
Capacité à travailler de façon autonome.
Motivation à apprendre et à acquérir de nouvelles expériences.
Capacité à gérer le stress et à s’adapter aux changements constants.
Détails du poste
:
40 heures par semaine
Les candidat(e)s doivent avoir l’autorisation légale de travailler au Canada
Salaire compétitif, établi selon vos compétences et votre expérience
Couverture d’assurance complète payée par Primero dès l’embauche
Régime de retraite avec contribution de l’employeur à hauteur de 5 %
Jusqu’à 10 journées de maladie payées par année
Code vestimentaire décontracté
Café, thé et fruits frais offerts tous les jours pour vous garder en forme
Horaire de travail flexible et mode hybride
Bureaux modernes situés au cœur du centre-ville de Montréal
Accès gratuit à une salle de sport
Environnement de travail convivial et décontracté avec un comité social actif
Pour postuler :
Envoyez votre CV à l’adresse suivante
:
RH@primero.ca
Nous vous remercions sincèrement de l’intérêt que vous portez à notre équipe.
Bien que toutes les candidatures soient examinées avec attention, seules les personnes retenues pour une entrevue seront contactées.

title: Electrician - Commissioning
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity:

Primero is seeking a Electrical and Instrumentation Commissioning Technician with strong commissioning experience to join our team on a 2:1 ongoing roster for a long-term project in Kalgoorlie, WA.

What you 'Can Do'

  • Have strong industrial working experience, at least 5 years
  • Flexible work ethic and able to adapt to changing work environments, including nightshift if required.
  • Good communication skills and accuracy in record keeping.
  • Excellent safety awareness and values  

Requirements

  • Trade Qualification in Electrical field
  • Cert 3/4 Instrumentation 
  • Valid WA Electrical Workers License
  • Relevant Commissioning experience
  • HV Licence 33Kv (Desirable), CPR/LVR (within 12 months), Working at Heights (Within 2 years)
  • HRWL - WP
  • Ability to pass a pre-employment medical & drug and alcohol screen
  • Willing to supply a National Coordination Criminal History Check (NCCHC)

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Career Opportunities
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities

title: Senior HSE Advisor
description_html:
Senior HSE Advisor

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity 

Site-based and hands-on, you will be contributing to the successful delivery of a newly awarded project.


Reporting to the HSE Manager/ HSE Superintendent, you will be responsible for directing and controlling all activities under your influence to ensure that these activities meet the Health, Safety, Environment and quality expectations of our clients whilst also delivering on time, within budget and to Primero standard.


The point of hire is Perth, Western Australia on a 2/1 FIFO roster.


Your Key Responsibilities

* Understand and communicate Primero HSE procedures and legislative requirements on site in accordance with the project specific HSE Management Plans.

* Undertaking daily HSE inspections and observations on site.

* Play an active role in the delivery of HSE topics in the weekly toolbox and daily prestart sessions.

*  Assisting with fitness for work requirements and daily welfare checks.

* Coach and guide HSR’s in their legislative HSE requirements.

* Provide support guidance to employees in the creation of risk assessments (JHA’s, Permits)

* Maintaining HSE notice boards.


What you ‘Can do’

* Possess a Certificate IV in Work, Health and Safety (Minimum requirement)

* Have a minimum of 3+ years' experience within the construction industry

* Demonstrated site experience in a similar role

* Hold a current Provide First Aid / CPR certificate

* Experienced with Incident Investigation Training (ICAM/Tap Root)

* Have a OHS Construction Induction White / Blue Card

* Demonstrate the Right to Work in Australia

* Must be able to pass a Pre-Employment Medical & Drug and Alcohol Screen


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Commissioning Engineer - Electrical and Instrumentation
description_html:
Commissioning Engineer (E&I)

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 


Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity

* This is a hands-on role where you’ll play a key part in the successful delivery of a billion dollar gold project

* Mobilisation to site on a FIFO 2:1 roster.


Your Key Responsibilities

* Demonstrable experience of pre-commissioning & commissioning electrical systems (33/11/0.415kV) on large scale mineral processing plants, preferably gold.

* Both brown field and green field experience is desirable.

* Experience in compiling and reviewing commissioning test packs for E&I systems.

* Ability to interpret engineering drawings, SLDs, TLDs, PIDs, PFDs & schematic drawings and produce technically accurate, complete, and easy to understand Commissioning reports.

* Experience with systemisation and a sub-systemisation approach to commissioning facilities 

* Experience with completions management tools – in the case of this project CCMS. 

* Ability to lead/supervise the E&I team undertaking commissioning activities

* Implement and ensure E&I systems are commissioned as per Commissioning management plan, test sheets, procedures.

* Trouble shooting and investigating E&I related problems, diagnosing and repairing faults.

* Ensuring safe working conditions.


What You ‘Can Do’

* Education:  Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering.

* Experience: At least 3+ years of broad-ranging experience Your background should include skills in planning, field commissioning.

* Technical Skills: Demonstrated proficiency in computer skills and familiarity with relevant software applications.

* Analytical Abilities: Strong analytical skills are essential. You’ll be responsible for evaluating data and making informed decisions.

* Effective Communication: Excellent communication skills are crucial. You’ll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, interact with joint venture partners, and provide clear technical advice.

* Interpersonal Skills: Ability to work well with others is vital. You’ll coordinate in-house or consultant studies, engage in discussions, and foster positive relationships.

* Adaptability: Given the dynamic environment, you should thrive in responding to diverse demands and frequently changing priorities and have an innate ability to work independently and prioritise.

* Current Drivers License

* Construction Induction – OHS White Card

* Strong perception and implementation of HSE


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.
