title: Electrical Superintendent
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

Primero are currently recruiting for an E&I Superintendent to join us on an exciting Major Construction Project This would be on a 2:1 Roster for a 12-18 Month Period

 

Reporting to the Construction Manager, you will plan, direct and control all activities under your influence and ensure that these activities meet the safety, health, environmental, design, quality, completion, and production targets as set by the site leadership team

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.
  • Ensure that all data requirements for robust projects and financial control are met consistently, completely and on a timely basis as directed by the site manager / project manager.
  • Directly accountable for setting up the Supervision Team to ensure that all activities are conducted in a safe manner for persons working on the site including sub-contractor’s workforce and visitors
  • In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.
  • Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issues.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics and engineering drawings. 
  • Ability to work effectively and lead by example the firm’s personnel and their sub-contractors.
  • Strong HSE understanding and implementation skills.
  • Possess significant experience within Major Construction Projects
  • Hold a Current WA Electrical Licence
  • Hold a Current CPR/LVR Certificate

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Flexible Working Arrangements 
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards
  • Onsite Gym

 

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

 

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

please apply now.

 

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

Your Opportunity

Primero is currently recruiting for Piping Superintendents to join us on a $1Billion EPC Greenfields & Brownfields upgrade of a Gold Processing Plant. This would be on a 2:1 Roster to Kalgoorlie for 12+ Months.

 

Reporting to the Area Construction Manager, you will plan, direct and control all activities under your influence and ensure that these activities meet the safety, health, environmental, design, quality, completion, and production targets as set by the site leadership team

 

Your Key Responsibilities

  • Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.

  • In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.
  • Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issues.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Previous experience on Gold Processing Plants (preferred) 
  • Significant Piping Experience
  • Strong planning of both Manning and Plant and Equipment. 
  • Strong ability to create and review SMP construction methodologies.
  • Ability to work effectively and lead by example the firm’s personnel and their sub-contractors.
  • Strong HSE understanding and implementation skills.
  • Possess significant experience within Major Concrete Packages

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

Primero is seeking a motivated and experienced Grouters to work on our current project in the Coastal Region of the Pilbara on a 2:1 roster.

title: Superintendent - Commissioning (E&I)
description_html:
Commissioning Superintendent – E&I

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.



About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.


Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity

This role is on-site and hands-on, you will play a key role in driving the project’s success.


Reporting to the Manager - Commissioning, you will oversee and manage all activities within your scope, ensuring compliance with health, safety, environmental, and quality standards while delivering on time, within budget, and to Primero’s high standards.


This role is FIFO on a 2/1 roster.


Your Key Responsibilities

* Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.

* Ensure that all data requirements for robust projects and financial control are met consistently, completely and on a timely basis as directed by the Manager - Commissioning.

* Directly accountable for setting up the Supervision Team to ensure that all activities are conducted in a safe manner for persons working on the site including sub-contractor’s workforce and visitors

* In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.

* Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issues.

* Analysis production records and coordinate mitigation strategies through review of data.

* Identify and ensure that change management is identified, and all costs associated with rectifying the changes are identified prior to undertaking the work and recorded and communicated with the Project Contracts Team during the undertaking of the works.

* Identify project manning requirements and ensure accurate forecasting of the requirement weekly.

* Monitor, expedite and resolve meeting action items attributed to you.

* Assist in the development and approval of risk assessments.

* Ensure that all personnel working on the site are competent or receive training as deemed necessary to the statutory requirements to carry out the tasks for which they are assigned.

* Ensure all incidents are immediately reported to the project manager and to the client site responsible person. Subsequently provide details of all incidents and the required corrective actions to site personnel.


What you ‘Can do’       

* Education:  Trade qualification Electrical

* Trade certificate

* Instrumentation Cert 3/4

* WA Electrical License

* Working At Heights (Within 12 months)

* High Risk License - WP

* CPR/LVR

* HV Licence 33Kv

* Must have 15+ years’ experience in construction of metallurgical process and/or oil and gas plants.

* Minimum 5+ years at Superintendent level.  

* Exposure to EPC environments is preferred.

* Unwavering commitment to a safety and team first approach.

* Must have current Appointed Persons - Schedule 26 qualifications

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

* Possess a strong understanding of applicable codes of practice.

* Ability to read and interpret blueprints, schematics and engineering drawings.

* Ability to be sufficiently flexible and resourceful to cope with the inherent load fluctuations of construction projects.

* OSH Construction Industry White/Blue Card (Mandatory).

* Ability to pass a Pre-Employment Medical & Drug and Alcohol Screen.



What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Electrical and Instrumentation Commissioning Supervisor
description_html:
Commissioning Supervisor – E&I

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity 

Primero is seeking an E&I Supervisor - Commissioning to join our team on a $1 billion EPC Greenfields & Brownfields upgrade of a Gold Processing Plant in Kalgoorlie. This is a long-term project operating on a 2:1 roster.


Your Key Responsibilities 

* Major project/chemical/gas/mining plant experience in a brownfield & greenfield environment

* Manage multiple work fronts at any one time-man & Material management

* Safely and successfully manage contractors on site to meet project schedules and milestones

* MS Outlook/Word/Excel knowledge desirable.

* CMMS/Completion Management System knowledge desirable

* Planning and scheduling experience commissioning activities with respect to subsystem/system priority

* Commissioning test pack, ITP and ITR preparation and completion.

* Supervise at least a team of 10 trades as part of a team during Commissioning stage.

* Work as part of a team, involved in construction and commissioning works at various sites from energization to process commissioning stage.

* Demonstrated a high level of personal commitment to safety and follow standard work practices.

* Perform maintenance, repairs and replacement of fixed plant equipment -rotating & stationary equipment, troubleshooting, maintaining, and repairing critical assets during various stages of commissioning.

* Utilise tools and engineering techniques to maintain and repair plant machinery and equipment.

* Liaise with inter-departmental supervisors to provide direction and support to workers so as to achieve targets and deadlines.

* Undertake safety and hazard assessments and ensure employees comply with OHS requirements.

* Interpret complex drawings (Schematics, SLD’s TLD’s, P&ID’s), diagrams and specifications and determine suitable materials.

* Conduct inspections and investigations of equipment to rectify issues and failures.

* Carry out shift cover duties at different stages of commissioning as required.

* Prepare and maintain commissioning records of site observations, testing processes and checklists.

* Prepare and maintain daily shift commissioning activity progress  report


What You ‘Can Do’

* Education:  Trade qualification Electrical

* Trade certificate

* Instrumentation Cert 3/4

* WA Electrical License

* Working At Heights (Within 12 months)

* High Risk License - WP

* CPR/LVR

* HV Licence 33Kv

* Experience: At least 5+ years of broad-ranging commissioning experience in O&G/Mining/Chemical. Should include skills in planning, workforce management, field commissioning.

* Technical Skills: Demonstrated proficiency in trade skill, computer skills and familiarity with relevant completion software applications.

* Analytical Abilities: Strong analytical skills are essential. You’ll be responsible for trouble shooting and process evaluation.

* Effective Communication: Excellent communication skills are crucial. You’ll collaborate with a multidisciplinary team, interact with joint venture partners, and provide clear technical advice.

* Interpersonal Skills: Ability to work well with others is vital. You’ll coordinate in-house or consultant studies, engage in discussions, and foster positive relationships.

* Adaptability: Given the dynamic environment, you should thrive in responding to diverse demands and frequently changing priorities and have an innate ability to work independently and prioritise.

* Current Drivers License

* Construction Induction – OHS White Card

* Strong perception and implementation of HSE


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

title: Principal Process Engineer (Toronto, ON)
description_html:
Principal Process Engineer

Location: Toronto, ON

Type: Permanent Full-time

 

Primero America’s team is currently looking for a Principal Process Engineer.
This is a unique opportunity to join our talented team and be part of Primero’s growth and success. Primero is an Australian-founded company, established in 2011 and growing consistently in Montreal since 2016. We expanded into Houston in 2022 and Toronto in 2023, strengthening our North American presence. We specialize in the design, procurement, and construction management of mineral processing plants

The Principal Process Engineer role will be responsible for the ongoing development and implementation of process engineering functions within Primero Americas. This includes the development, organization, engineering, and oversight of all feasibility studies, laboratory testing, and control of process activities to ensure compliance with the company's safety, health, environmental, quality, completion, and production goals. Additionally, the role may involve supporting business development initiatives to maintain the workload and efficiency of the design office.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Act as the technical authority for metallurgy and process-related matters, providing expert guidance and support to teams and consultants. Focus on continuous improvements of existing facilities, including health & safety, security, work procedures, technical training and coaching, long term economics optimization of mine and processing sites and compliance with applicable codes and regulations.
  • Development of computer-based training modules for operations, Health & Safety, Sampling / Laboratory procedures and others.
  • Responsibility to complete scoping, pre-feasibility and bankable feasibility level studies.  Team building on projects, at engineering companies and mine sites.  Provided recommendation to property purchases, long / short term strategies, demerger and M&A.
  • Project development / engineering management for mineral and mining industry on various projects
  • In depth experience in mineral processing including gold / silver / lithium / cobalt recovery, sulphide and oxide flotation, gravity concentration, dense medium separation, crushing, grinding, screening, thickening, filters, etc. 
  • Business development, marketing and sales, as required


What We’re Looking For: 

  • Tertiary or equivalent qualification in production and engineering
  • At least five (15) years’ experience in engineering, operation and/or commissioning works
  • Experience in the mining industry, with a strong focus on gold and copper operations and design.
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills; English essential, French an asset.
  • Ability to work effectively with colleagues, clients, and multidisciplinary teams.
  • Solid understanding of HSE principles, applicable codes, and engineering standards.
  • Skilled at reading and interpreting specifications, schematics, and engineering drawings.
  • Flexible, resourceful, and able to perform under pressure and continuous change.
  • Committed to delivering quality work on schedule and leading by example.
  • Business development and client relationship management experience.
  • Team-oriented, safety-focused, service-minded, and driven by integrity and company growth.

 

Position details:

  • 40 hours per week
  • Applicants must have legal authorization to work in Canada
  • Competitive salary tailored to your skills and experience
  • Full insurance coverage paid by Primero from day one
  • Retirement plan with 5% employer matching
  • Up to 10 Paid sick days per year
  • Casual dress code
  • Coffee available daily 
  • Flexible, possibility of hybrid work schedule
  • Offices in the heart of downtown Toronto


Send your application to: HR@primero.ca

title: Project Engineer - SMP
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

Primero are currently recruiting for Project Engineers with SMP experience to join our Construction Project teams on FIFO 2:1 rosters.

 

Your Key Responsibilities


  • Proactively communicate with the superintendents, supervisors and project engineers and stay abreast of project communication to autonomously develop and manage work tasks and priorities
  • Communicate with the supervisors and leading hands to understand daily construction progress and capture in the QMR to support project tracking
  • Read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation /report.
  • Perform calculations for site modification and general site engineering problem solving using engineering formulas and skills.
  • Compile and maintain workpacks of relevant information to support construction works by the site SMP team e.g drawings.
  • Provide technical support to the supervisors, leading hands and trades for execution of the workpacks.
  • Communicate with the design team to resolve issues identified with design information in preparing and executing workpacks
  • Communicate with the planning team to resolve issues identified with data entry into QMR
  • Redline markup design information with site as constructed information where there are differences 
  • Provide engineering support to close out completion of construction activities e.g. participate in walkdowns, ITRs and punch lists documentation
  • Communicate and work with the site project engineers to develop and maintain various trackers with the aim to provide visibility on location and quantity of construction materials

 

What You ‘Can Do’


  • Significant SMP experience on Major Projects
  • Experience with managing multiple packages and subcontractors
  • Strong and effective communication and problem-solving skills

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

 

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

 

APPLY NOW

 

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please Apply Now.

 

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you. 

Your Opportunity

Primero is seeking a motivated and experienced Electricians to work across our current projects – we are currently offering a 2:1 roster in Karratha. 

What you 'Can Do'

  • Have strong industrial construction working experience, at least 5 years
  • Ability to complete steel conduit work, cable ladder and control panel terminations
  • Ability to read electrical Drawings, P&IDs and ISO’s (required for heat tracing)
  • Flexible work ethic and able to adapt to changing work environments, including nightshift for upcoming shutdowns
  • Good communication skills and accuracy in record keeping.
  • Excellent safety awareness and values 

Requirements

  • Australian Certified Trade Certificate
  • Qualified Electrician (WA A Grade Electrical Licence)
  • CPR/LVR certificate (valid within 12 months)
  • Provide First Aid Certificate
  • Drivers Licence C-Class
  • High Risk Work Licence (WP)
  • Confined space Entry
  • Working at Heights
  • Rio Tinto Inductions (highly desirable)
  • Ability to pass a pre-employment medical & drug and alcohol screen

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Career Opportunities
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

title: Electrical Supervisor
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 


Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity 

Primero are currently recruiting for Electrical Supervisors to join our team on various Construction Projects. Working on a 2:1 FIFO Roster, we have both Day SHift and Nightshift Opportunities. These are all long-term proejcts with 6-12 Months ahead.


Your Key Responsibilities 

* Proactively plan the works assigned to you on the project to ensure that the resources required to meet your primary purpose are adequate and fit for purpose.

* Directly accountable for setting up the worksite to ensure that all activities can be conducted in a safe manner for persons working on the site including sub-contractor’s workforce and visitors.

* In all dealings with Primero’s clients or prospective clients, develop relationships which maximise the likelihood of repeat or initial business opportunities.

* Effectively manage multiple jobs on site with several leading hands and/or sub-contractors.

* Liaise with client representatives or sub-contractors on technical and minor contractual issue.

* Responsible for ensuring that pre-start meetings are held daily with all personnel working on the site including subcontractor personnel. 

* Report all construction and technical issues immediately to the site engineering team.


What You ‘Can Do’

* Tertiary/Trade or suitably Qualified.

* At least five (5) years’ experience in construction works.

* Experience in the resource (mining/oil & gas) industries.

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

* Strong daily and weekly planning abilities of assigned tasks.

* Ability to work effectively with the firm’s personnel and sub-contractors.

* Strong HSE understanding and implementation skills.


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Flexible Working Arrangements

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

title: SMP Supervisor
description_html:
Primero 
 If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

About Us
 Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time.

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity
• Primero is currently recruiting for SMP Supervisors to join Multiple Exciting Projects.
 • Site-based and hands-on, you will be contributing to the successful delivery of the project on behalf of our client.
 • You will be primarily responsible for assisting the SMP Superintendents and Construction Manager in determining priorities, meeting strict deadlines and managing crews whilst having the ability to work under pressure with minimal supervision.
 • FIFO Roster: 2:1

Your Key Responsibilities
 • The ability to liaise with procurement personnel for all necessary material and consumable requirements.
 • The ability to read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation and/or reports.
 • The capacity to plan, schedule, conduct, and/or coordinate detailed phases of assigned project work.
 • Supervise and coordinate structural, mechanical, and piping installation activities to meet project targets.
 • Ensure that safety, quality, and environmental standards are consistently met or exceeded.
 • Lead daily pre-start meetings and toolbox talks to maintain team engagement and safety focus.
 • Monitor workforce performance and provide coaching and support to ensure productivity and quality outcomes.
 • Liaise with subcontractors, vendors, and internal teams to resolve construction challenges and maintain project momentum.
 • Conduct inspections to verify that works are completed to design and specification before handover.

What You ‘Can Do’
 • Significant experience as an SMP Supervisor on Major Projects.
 • Experience with managing blue collar crew and subcontractors.
 • Experience in multi-discipline, mining project delivery.
 • Ability to read and interpret design drawings, schematics and other engineering drawings.
 • Proven leadership skills with the ability to motivate teams and manage performance effectively.
 • Strong understanding of SMP construction methodologies and industry best practices.
 • Solid knowledge of safety systems, permit to work processes, and risk assessments on large projects.
 • Ability to work collaboratively in a high-pressure, schedule-driven environment.
 • Competency in using construction management software and Microsoft Office suite.

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:
 • Competitive Compensation
 • Career Opportunities
 • Paid Parental Leave
 • Health and Wellbeing Support
 • Benefits & Discounts
 • Employee Referral Rewards

Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 


Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

 

Your Opportunity

We are looking for a Site Administrator to join our newly awarded project on a 2:1 roster

Reporting into the Site Manager, you will be responsible for providing a high standard of general administrative services, including data entry, document control, personnel movements inclusive of training, leave, labour hire and shutdown support staff to ensure continued smooth running of the project.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

* Perform daily administrative activities on the project site. 

* Coordinate with various departments to ensure smooth workflow and communication. 

* Assist the recruitment team with onboarding of new site personnel. 

* Manage workforce planner, organise travel arrangements and accommodations for site staff. 

* Maintain and manage inventory of office supplies and site equipment. 

* Support payroll processes, ensuring timely and accurate submissions. 

* Act as a liaison between on-site teams and other departments. 

* Support health and safety personnel with KPI’s and maintaining compliance. 

* Address client (EPCM) inquiries in a professional and timely manner. 

* Contribute to process improvements and support the implementation of best practices.


What You ‘Can Do’

* Demonstrated experience in a similar position, within the construction or resources industries

* Ability to demonstrate strong relationship building and networking skills.

* Strong verbal and written communication skills. 

* Proven track record in a similar role 

* Proficient with modern IT applications including Microsoft Excel, Work and Outlook.

* Prior experience using INX, Workflow or RapidCrews (Preferred)


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.


APPLY NOW


If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.


Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.


Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

title: Electrical Project Engineer
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity 

We are currently looking for multiple experienced Electrical Project Engineers to join our Site Electrical Teams on multiple Greenfields Projects. This is a long-term project operating on a 2:1 roster with an extremely exciting opportunity to play a key role in both the Construction and Commissioning of these projects.


Your Key Responsibilities 

  • Proactively communicate with the electrical superintendents, electrical supervisors and senior engineers and stay abreast of project communication to autonomously develop and manage work tasks and priorities
  • Communicate with the electrical supervisors and leading hands to understand daily construction progress and capture in the QMR to support project tracking
  • Read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation /report.
  • Perform calculations for site modification and general site engineering problem solving using engineering formulas and skills.
  • Compile and maintain workpacks of relevant electrical design information to support construction works by the site electrical team e.g drawings, cable schedules, model shots
  • Provide technical support to the electrical supervisors, leading hands and electricians for execution of the workpacks.
  • Communicate with the design team to resolve issues identified with design information in preparing and executing workpacks
  • Communicate with the planning team to resolve issues identified with data entry into QMR
  • Redline markup design information with site as constructed information where there are differences
  • Provide engineering support to close out completion of construction activities e.g. participate in walkdowns, ITRs and punch lists documentation
  • Communicate and work with the site project engineers to develop and maintain various trackers with the aim to provide visibility on location and quantity of construction materials, e.g. cables, instruments, equipment
  • Site verification of deliveries and engineering support for orderly storage of construction materials


What You ‘Can Do’

* University degree in a relevant discipline (Electrical).

* Experience in multi-discipline, EPC projects.

* Experience in the mining or energy industry with on-site works during construction and commissioning being essential.

* Experience with installation of steel piping systems and heavy mechanical equipment.

* Experience in management and implementation of quality control and assurance.

* Possess a strong understanding of applicable codes.


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.

Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.

title: Crane & Rigging Supervisor
description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.

 

About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 

 

Find out what a career at Primero Can Do for you.


Your Opportunity 

Primero are currently recruiting for a Crane & Rigging Supervisor to join our $1Billion EPC Project in Kalgoorlie on a 2:1 Roster. The role itself will play an integral role in planning, coordinating and ensuring our Heavy Lift operations run smoothly, safely and correctly across the Project.


Working closely with the Site Leadership Team, as well as multiple Package Manager's to ensure we are able to lift some of the worlds largest equipment for a State of the Art and brand new Gold Processing Plant.


Your Key Responsibilities 

  • The ability to liaise with procurement personnel for all necessary material and consumable requirements.
  • The ability to read and interpret specifications, technical drawings, schematics, and any other engineering documentation and/or reports.
  • The capacity to plan, schedule, conduct, and/or coordinate detailed phases of assigned project work.
  • Supervise and coordinate structural, mechanical, and piping installation activities to meet project targets.
  • Ensure that safety, quality, and environmental standards are consistently met or exceeded.
  • Lead daily pre-start meetings and toolbox talks to maintain team engagement and safety focus.
  • Monitor workforce performance and provide coaching and support to ensure productivity and quality outcomes.
  • Liaise with subcontractors, vendors, and internal teams to resolve construction challenges and maintain project momentum.
  • Conduct inspections to verify that works are completed to design and specification before handover.

 

What You ‘Can Do’

  • Significant experience as a Structural or Rigging Supervisor on Major Projects.
  • Experience with managing blue collar crew and subcontractors.
  • Experience in multi-discipline, mining project delivery.
  • Ability to read and interpret design drawings, schematics and other engineering drawings.
  • Proven leadership skills with the ability to motivate teams and manage performance effectively.
  • Strong understanding of SMP construction methodologies and industry best practices.
  • Solid knowledge of safety systems, permit to work processes, and risk assessments on large projects.
  • Ability to work collaboratively in a high-pressure, schedule-driven environment.
  • Competency in using construction management software and Microsoft Office suite.

 

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Career Opportunities
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits and Discounts
  • Employee Referral Rewards

If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.

 

APPLY NOW

If you believe you have what it takes and want to work for a company who put its people first, please apply now.
 
Primero is an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourages female and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants.
 
 Follow us on LinkedIn for news, updates and career opportunities.

description_html:

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity

We are looking for HSET Administrator to join our site team working on a billion dollar gold expansion project. 


Roster: 2:1


Your Key Responsibilities

* Set up and manage HSE Files and folder structures, maintaining discipline with record management and remove or archive duplications or obsolete files.  Follow up on missing entries, (e.g. minutes, attendance registers, crane lift studies)

* Prepare, collate, obtain information for Daily, Weekly and Monthly reports.

* Prepare HSE meeting agendas, take minutes, maintain records.

* Assist with setting up and managing investigations.

* Entering data into databases/programs.

* Developing Site Notices after being given the salient points.

* Monitor and manage team PPE stocks.  Manage the team safety equipment register, ensure equipment is signed out, in good condition and calibrated.

* Produce KPI participation reports.  


What You ‘Can Do’

* Demonstrated experience in a similar position, within the construction or resources industries

* Ability to demonstrate strong relationship building and networking skills.

* Strong verbal and written communication skills. 

* Proven track record in a similar role 

* Proficient with modern IT applications including Microsoft Excel, Work and Outlook.


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Contemporary Rostering 

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

description_html:
If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy.

Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.

Your Opportunity

Primero is seeking a motivated and experienced Pipefitters & Mechanical Fitters to join our project in the Pilbara Region, currently offering a 2:1 FIFO Roster. 

What you 'Can Do'

  • Have strong industrial construction working experience, at least 5 years
  • Flexible work ethic and able to adapt to changing work environments, including nightshift if required.
  • Good communication skills and accuracy in record keeping.
  • Excellent safety awareness and values

Requirements

  • Australian / NZ Trade Qualification (Metal Fabrication or similar)
  • Drivers Licence C-Class
  • High Risk Work Licence - EWP
  • Working at Heights (2 year validity)
  • Ability to pass a pre-employment medical & drug and alcohol screen
  • Willing to supply a National Coordination Criminal History Check (NCCHC)

What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

  • Competitive Compensation
  • Contemporary Rostering
  • Career Opportunities
  • Health and Wellbeing Support
  • Benefits & Discounts

Primero is seeking a motivated and experienced Electricians to work across our current projects – we are currently offering 2:1 Rosters in Kalgoorlie or in Pilbara. 

What you 'Can Do'

  • Have strong industrial construction working experience, at least 5 years
  • Ability to complete steel conduit work, cable ladder and control panel terminations
  • Ability to read electrical Drawings, P&IDs and ISO’s (required for heat tracing)

  • Good communication skills and accuracy in record keeping.

title: HSE Advisor
description_html:
HSE Advisor

If you’re looking for a career with a company that has a ‘Can Do’ attitude, then look no further than Primero. We’re a team of skilled and determined problem solvers, who back our projects, and each other. We’re energised by our culture, anchored by our values, and driven to deliver for our clients. Join us if you take pride in having a ‘Can Do’ attitude.


About Us 

Primero, a subsidiary of NRW Holdings, is a multi-national engineering, procurement, and construction business. Since we were founded in 2011, we’ve grown and diversified, delivering projects in over ten different countries, spanning five continents, from locations in Australia and North America. Our rapid growth is testament to our ability to deliver quality project outcomes, safely and on time. 

Working with us you’ll learn from some of the brightest and smartest minds in the business, while delivering important projects throughout Australia and overseas, giving you the opportunity to gain access to unique experiences across a huge range of sectors, from gold to lithium and new energy. 


Find out what a career at Primero can do for you.


Your Opportunity

Primero is seeking HSE Advisors to join our Projects Team. We’re expanding our HSE team due to a number of newly awarded projects.


Roster: 2:1


Your Key Responsibilities

* Understand and communicate Primero HSE procedures and legislative requirements on site in accordance with the project specific HSE Management Plans.

* Undertaking daily HSE inspections and observations on site.

* Play an active role in the delivery of HSE topics in the weekly toolbox and daily prestart sessions.

* Assisting with fitness for work requirements and daily welfare checks.

* Coach and guide HSR’s in their legislative HSE requirements.

* Provide support guidance to employees in the creation of risk assessments (JHA’s, Permits)

* Maintaining HSE notice boards.


What You ‘Can Do’

*   Possess a Certificate IV in Work, Health and Safety (Minimum requirement)

*   Have a minimum of 3+ years' experience within the construction industry

*   Demonstrated site experience in a similar role

*   Hold a current Provide First Aid / CPR certificate

*   Experienced with Incident Investigation Training (ICAM/Tap Root)

*   Have a OHS Construction Induction White / Blue Card

*   Demonstrate the Right to Work in Australia

*   Must be able to pass a Pre-Employment Medical & Drug and Alcohol Screen


What we ‘Can Do’ for you:

* Competitive Compensation

* Career Opportunities 

* Paid Parental Leave

* Health and Wellbeing Support

* Benefits & Discounts

* Employee Referral Rewards


If you're looking for a career where you experience more 'Can Do', then we're the team for you.


Find out what a Primero career Can Do for you.
